boardgame.name: Cultist Chaos
boardgame.description:
Cultist Chaos is a card drafting game for 2-6 players. Each player leads their own cult and gains points by collecting magical items, gathering sacrifices, and summoning powerful deities to defeat their opponents.

It is a compact party game consisting of only cards, and only taking 15-25 minutes per round.

boardgame.name: Dicetopia: Faction Pack #2
boardgame.description: 5 new community based Factions for Dicetopia!

boardgame.name: Marvel Champions: GeekMod Box & Insert
boardgame.description:
Great solution for storing Marvel Champions. Fits sleeved cards.

This product includes a wooden storage box + dedicated insert for organizing your game inside the box.

Box dimensions: 29,5cm x 39,5cm x 13cm

boardgame.name: Dan Dare Space Shooting Game
boardgame.description:
Dan Dare Space Shooting game by Glevum has a target board featuring 3 enemy spaceships. The gun, as is often the case in British games, is a curious metal device, that fires the shot using a spring mechanism. After a pre-set number of turns, the winner is the one with the most successful hits.

During the early 1950's the Comic Hero Dan Dare spurred several similar target games that can easily be confused. Featured on this link is Glevum's version titled "Dan Dare Space Shooting" game.

Listed elsewhere on BGG is two from Chad Valley; that being simply "Dan Dare Shooting" game and the other called "Dan Dare Big Game Hunt on Venus".

—user summary

boardgame.name: Necromunda: Hive War
boardgame.description:
Starter box for Necromunda

Necromunda is a world of mines, factories, refineries, and processing plants. The planet is a vast powerhouse of industry, making thousands and thousands of different items for use throughout nearby planetary systems. In the darkness of the underhive, fights between the clan houses over the limited resources are a way of life for the citizens of Necromunda.

Jump into the world of skirmish wargaming with Necromunda: Hive War. Choose your gang and fight thrilling, fast-paced tactical games set in the darkness of the underhive. This boxed set is perfect for new players and contains all of the rules, models, and accessories that you need to start gaming. As well as two gangs, the box also includes enough terrain to build your own little corner of Necromunda.

The boxed set contains:

20 plastic miniatures, each supplied with a Citadel 25mm Round Necromunda Base:
– 10 Escher gang members
– 10 Delaque gang members

– An array of modular terrain
– Double-sided gaming mat
– All of the dice, tokens, cards, and templates needed to play

Also included is a 104-page softback rulebook containing:
– Background on the planet of Necromunda and its Houses
– The rules for playing games of Necromunda
– Multiple scenarios to play through
– Rules for creating your own gang
– Rules for the weapons and wargear available to gangs

boardgame.name: King of Tokyo/King of New York: Kawaii Ju (promo character)
boardgame.description: Kawaii Ju is a promo monster for King of Tokyo and King of New York. It was first available during the Man vs Meeple kickstarter Season 4 (2021).

boardgame.name: Zoo memória
boardgame.description:
It's a mess at the zoo. The puppies have escaped and are now running around happily, playing hide and seek. They have no idea that the zoo director is on his way to the entrance. Help them find their way back to their parents before he gets there!

An exciting cooperative game that develops observation skills and encourages players to think together.

boardgame.name: Sheep Hop!
boardgame.description:
Sheep Hop is playable as a team or solo, from 5 years old. In this cooperative game, bring the sheep back to the sheepfold without them being caught by the wolves!
Cross the obstacles that line the meadow, and especially beware of the wolves patrolling! Logic, reflection and mutual aid will bring as many sheep as possible to safety! An evolving game, with several levels of difficulty, based on a game of checkers mechanics, which allows the sheep to chain epic movements across the board and its obstacles.

boardgame.name: Ascent of the Leviathan (5E)
boardgame.description:
The ship has been breached by a monstrous jellyfish! Will you be able to delve within and find a solution on how to free your ship? A sea adventure for characters of Level 2-4 for 5th Edition of the most popular Roleplaying Game.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Ascent of the Leviathan (OSE)
boardgame.description:
The ship has been breached by a monstrous jellyfish! Will you be able to delve within and find a solution on how to free your ship?

A sea adventure for characters of level 2-4 using Old School Essential rules.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Ascent of the Leviathan (OSRIC)
boardgame.description:
The ship has been breached by a monstrous jellyfish! Will you be able to delve within and find a solution on how to free your ship?

A sea adventure for characters of level 2-4 using OSRIC rules.

- from the publisher's blurb
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: Gyllagoon's Island
boardgame.description:
Shipwrecked upon a deserted island the party soon realizes they are not alone. Populated by intelligent and savage red haired apes, the heroes must fight for survival and find a means for getting off the jungle island. These hungry apes are eager for the taste of man flesh and are ruled over by something not of this world that thrives on hunting and terrorizing intruders within its domain...

Gyllagoon's Island is an adventure for characters of level 5-7.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Star Realms: Stingray Promo Card
boardgame.description:
Name: Stingray
Type: Blob ship
Cost: 2
Attack: 5
When you recycle the ship you gain 2 tokens.

Promotional card given out on a Wise Wizards giveaway via a social media platform.

boardgame.name: Luxastra: il Gioco da Tavolo
boardgame.description:
From tabletop to YouTube and back! Luxastra finally has its own boardgame: with an easy, yet deep gameplay, you too can become a true hero of a faraway fantasy land. Play alone or up to six players, choose between the six protagonists of the Luxastra Fist Season: each of them has its own tableu, cards, powers... and every one is unique!

In this cooperative adventure game, you move around the city of Fatumastra together with your allies. You will need to find the dreaded Portal of Corialus to defeat one of the many bosses included in the box. To do so, you move tile by tile, facing many obstacles, traps, and enemies and you use your cards to attack, defend, assist your allies and try to pass as many trials as you can. You must be fast: each turn, the enemy Menace might increase... and when it reaches 20 the game is over! Try not to do it too fast, though: being too tired makes you vulnerable, and even one fallen hero will mark the end of your adventure.

May the Raven King be with you!


Dal tavolo alla Rete e ritorno! Luxastra ha finalmente il suo gioco in scatola, l’apice di una lunga collaborazione tra InnTale e Fantàsia Edizioni, firmato dall’autore emergente Gianluca Horton, e in esclusiva assoluta.

Un’esperienza semplice ma coinvolgente, giocabile in solitaria o in gruppi da due a sei giocatori, dove ciascun partecipante può diventare un vero eroe. Scegliete tra i sei Personaggi Giocanti della Prima Serie di Luxastra: ognuno di loro ha la sua plancia, i suoi poteri, il suo mazzo, e tutti quanti sono assolutamente unici ed iconici.

Usate le vostre carte per attaccare, difendervi, curare i vostri alleati e volgere i combattimenti a vostro favore. Ma non dimenticate che le vostre forze non sono infinite, e che restare senza energie durante il combattimento potrebbe rendervi la vita difficile, visto che non potete fermarvi.

Ad ogni turno, dovrete cercare di farvi strada per la città Fatumastra, sempre di corsa tra le sue vie labirintiche. Tra vicoli ciechi, orde di nemici sul piede di guerra, artefatti nascosti nei luoghi più imprevedibili, mentre la Minaccia continua a crescere e la mano invisibile del Fato cala su di voi.

Non c’è tempo da perdere! Perché una volta che la Minaccia raggiungerà il valore massimo, il destino di tutta Delphes sarà segnato, e voi non potete permetterlo. Radunate i vostri amici, sedetevi al tavolo da gioco e accettate la sfida.

Che il Re Corvo vegli su di voi.

boardgame.name: Black Powder Red Earth 28mm
boardgame.description: A skirmish game with optional longer campaign structures, Black Powder Red Earth 28mm is designed to be fast, violent and streamlined. Games take around 15-20 minutes, and the action begins from turn one — survival is not guaranteed. Bloodshed is.

boardgame.name: Demeter: Bonus Objectives
boardgame.description:
Two double sided tiles that gives you a total of four new objectives:


Combination of red + blue cards selected (5 - 6 is silver, 7+ gold)
Combination of yellow + purple cards selected (5 - 6 is silver, 7+ gold)
Number of grey cards selected (3 is silver, 4 gold)
Number of buildings (1 - 2 is silver, 0 gold)

boardgame.name: Conqueror of Dune
boardgame.description:
Conqueror of Dune is a game for 1-5 players based on the books by Frank Herbert about desert planet Arrakis, also known as – Dune. In this game, player will take control of one of 5 houses; house
Atreides, house Harkonnen, house Corriono, house Ordos or Fremen tribes. Objective of the game is to accumulate the highest influence in the Lanssrad and control at least 3 locations on the planet. To do this, players will use Spice and Troops of their house to sway numerous battles to their advantage.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Sniper Elite: Eagle's Nest
boardgame.description:
The expansion adds two new maps to the game – the infamous Eagle’s Nest and the Heavy Water Facility – each providing the Allied Sniper and the defending Axis forces with new challenges to face.

It also includes 4 alternate Snipers for the Allied player to choose from at the start of the game, each with their own unique skillset and miniature to represent them. Choose between Karl and Rosa from Sniper Elite, Jun from Zombie Army, and Major Eazy from the Battle comics.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Journey to Aufstrag
boardgame.description:
From the publisher's website:

Journey to Aufstrag Box Set Includes the Following:
Journey to Aufstrag Adventure Modules A6-12
Map Booklet for Quick Reference
The Gray Pools Area Map
Town Map of Grafika

[...]

The Shadow of Aufstrag stains all the lands of the east. That dread tower that housed all the raving madness of hell sits now in the midst of the Gray Pools, a monolith of evil and ruin. Though the Horned God who built it is long gone, there are powers there that reach far and wide, into the lands beyond.

Begin the journey north, across the Blighted Screed, to the Fortress of towers and along the edge of the Gray Pools. The road is long and hard and set with evil, great and small, and the end of it lies upon the Wasting Way, that causeway that spans the Pools and brings one to the Ahargon Den, the Mouth of Darkness. Brave the long walk to the those gates and reap either death or entry.

Through the desolation of Unklar, the Journey to Aufstrag unfolds, and the Umbrage Saga continues.

Journey to Aufstrag is an adventure for 3-8 mid to high-level characters. It contains overland and dungeon adventures and brings the characters to the gates of Aufstrag. There is enough setting material and adventure hooks to allow the CK to create multiple adventures.

Journey to Aufstrag Box Set Includes the following Adventures:

A6 Of Banishment and Blight

A7 Beneath the Despairing Stone

A8 Forsaken Mountain

A9 Beneath the Helm of Night

A10 The Last Respite

A11 The Wasting Way

A12 The Paladin’s Lament

boardgame.name: Platoon Commander Deluxe: Kursk Strategy Guide
boardgame.description:
A full-color, 28-page strategy guide. Included are tactical tips, an extensive example of play, and unit analysis.

It's also a full enhancement of every section of the rule book:

Overview
counters
stacking

Action cards
Imitative
Rally
Fire
Movement
Close Assault
Aid and Focus counter explanation
Terrain explanation


The rules above are in most regards better than those in the original Rulebook, meaning it's more an expanded rules set than a strategy guide.

—user's summary
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Platoon Commander Deluxe: The Battle of Kursk

boardgame.name: Marvel Multiverse Role-Playing Game Playtest Rulebook
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

INTRODUCING THE MARVEL MULTIVERSE ROLE-PLAYING GAME!

Take on the roles of Marvel's most famous Super Heroes--or create entirely new ones--to fight some of the most dangerous Super Villains in the Marvel Universe! Join Marvel and tabeltop RPG fans alike in this preview of the Marvel Multiverse Role-Playing Game. Written by co-creator Matt Forbeck (The Marvel Encyclopedia, Dungeons & Dragons: Endless Quest) and packed with illustrations by Marvel's amazing artists, the Playtest Rulebook features a subset of rules for the upcoming game--including character creation and combat--plus an introductory scenario and full profiles for some of Marvel's greatest heroes: Spider-Man, Captain America, Captain Marvel, Wolverine and more. To get started, all you need is this book, three regular dice and a group of friends. Pkayers who grab the Playtest Rulebook will also will also have the chance to offer feedback on the rules and help shape the game for its full release. Don't miss out on this chance to influence and enjoy the Marvel Multiverse Role-Playing Game!

boardgame.name: A Most Fearful Sacrifice: Map Border Strips
boardgame.description:
This is a package of 4 neoprene border strips that were available through the Kickstarter. They may be available at a later date through the FPG website. Most Scenarios in A Most Fearful Sacrifice don't use the entire map. Sure, you can mark what is used with those map-edge marker counters, but they slide across the map every time you reach for your Zacapa XO.

These attractive, 2" x 14" neoprene border strips will mark your map edges in the smaller scenarios without sliding. No fuss, and no muss. There are 4 border strips per package: Two Union and two Confederate.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: A Most Fearful Sacrifice: The Three Days of Gettysburg

boardgame.name: ZorkQuest: Assault on Egreth Castle
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Zork Quest is an adventure game where the goal is to defeat an evil wizard. The game has mostly text but also pictures. During the game the player needs to make choices that affect the storyline. The game has several main heroes, and during the game the player will see the story from their different views.

boardgame.name: Drawing Without Dignity: Expansion Pack 1
boardgame.description:
The first expansion to the hit party drawing game, Drawing Without Dignity. Even more fun things to draw with your friends, and introduces a WILD new game mechanic!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Drawing Without Dignity: An Adult Party Game of Uncensored Sketches

boardgame.name: Beautiful Anomalies Plot Deck
boardgame.description:
Explore the razor's edge of time in a universe of Sufficiently Advanced Theology!

This is the official 52-card Plot Deck for Beautiful Anomalies, used to resolve conflicts and empower players to introduce setting-appropriate plot twists.

You can also use the twists for any other space-and-time-traveling or world-hopping game, and the numbers double as 4-sided dice. And they're great for storytelling aids in an improvisational solo game!

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Porphyra Core Rulebook
boardgame.description:
In June of 2015, Purple Duck Games published Drow of Porphyra - Karza, Children of the Loomqueen by Patricia Willenborg without the Pathfinder Compatibility License. This products explore some mature themes that were appropriate for the content of the product and for our Lands of Porphyra Campaign Setting but not for the compatibility license.

As 2015 progressed, we released more supplements using open game content from the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game but abandoned our claims of official compatibility as we actively worked to change some minor aspects of the game both in our products and at my gaming table. Now with the recent announcement of what is generally being referred to as Pathfinder 2.0, we have decided to formalize our work as the Porphyra Roleplaying Game.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: inTENse
boardgame.description:
inTENse is a light and fun roll and write game for infinite players.
Your objective is to fill in the grid with dice rolls to create sums of 10, as well earn bonus points which are added to your score at the end of the game.
The player with the highest score after 10 rounds, wins!

Play alone, or with an infinite # of friends.

boardgame.name: Spell Write
boardgame.description:
Spell Write is a light and fun roll and write game for infinite players.
Your objective is to fill in the Play Grid with 2-4 letter words, as well as earn bonus points along the way.
The player with the highest score by the end of 14 rounds wins the game!

Play alone, or with an infinite # of friends.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Besieged: Build Your Castle!
boardgame.description:
Gather Resources. Develop Technology. Build your Castle. Assemble your Army. BESIEGE THE ENEMY!

Play out highly competitive epic siege battles to become the new king! Includes brand new game mechanic - Castle Building!

Draft cards to build a deck, develop technology and strategically build your castle with walls, towers, traps and moats before you besiege each other's castles to kill the King!

Every game is unique, every castle designed becomes the game board. Play is simultaneous for everyone! No taking turns! No boring waits!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Dungeon Delving Deck
boardgame.description:
Take your 5e game anywhere and help prisoners find heroes.
Preview of Card Faces with Dice Numbers

The Dungeon Delving Deck provides an amazing amount of help running 5e games:


a regular card deck (Ace-King and Joker for each Suit)
provides dice rolls for d4, d6, d8, d10, d12 and d20
geomorphs for designing your own dungeon
spell and conditions reference for 5e


- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Hätten Sie's gewußt?
boardgame.description:
Any number of people can participate in the game.

Pink Cards: Can be played as a question and answer.
However, since it contains a play on words (root play!), only the first word can be said to a player. This now has to form the other words from the existing stem of the word. Whoever brings together the correct words and has the most cards is the winner.

Green cards : The game is played as a question and answer. One player receives all the cards and takes turns asking the other players the questions printed on the cards. Whoever can answer the respective question receives the card. The answer is printed on the back. Whoever has the most green cards at the end is the winner.

As a question and answer game, you can also ask the answer on the back as a question to a fellow player and expand the game according to the rules as above.

Both games are also suitable as quartet games for children. 4 cards with 4 identical characters, which are attached to the top left of the card, belong together and form a quartet. Whoever can lay down the most quartets wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Addio
boardgame.description:
Addio ("Farewell" in Italian) is a solo, print-and-play card game inspired by Ernest Hemingway's A Farewell to Arms. Set on the front lines of Northern Italy during WWI, you must cross the landscape and evade both the Italian caribinieri and the Austro-Hungarian troops to reach the arms of your lover, who is waiting on the shores of Lake Maggiore.

Failure can come in many forms. You can be captured by dynamic Italian or Austro-Hungarian units, fall victim to starvation, or arrive at Lake Maggiore too broke to purchase the rowing boat needed to reach safety.

At stages in your journey the player counter will rest on cards representing towns, fields, and battles – opportunities, respectively, to find temporary employment and gather intel, forage for food (an activity not without risk), and fight or bribe your way out of trouble. If you opt to travel at night, there’s a fair chance now and again you’ll end up in places you had no intention of visiting.

—description from the designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: 13 Mots
13 Words
13 Wörter
boardgame.description:
13 Words is the new cooperative idea associations party game. The game is accessible, simple and fun!

The Captain finds the most obvious link between the cards around the board and the card at the center. The Captain indicates their choice on their answer wheel and then, the other players try to guess the Captain’s choice. All the players that correctly guessed the Captain’s word win a star and so does the Captain. A new turn starts and the Captain changes. Once the game is over, the total number of stars won among all the players determines the success level of the team.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Shrine of the Jade Scorpion
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Beyond the Kingdom of Hanging Blossom, deep in the mysterious jungle is a shrine that holds the key to saving your village. Whether you must save your village elder, entreat with the gods to spare your settlement, or embark on a journey to come of age, the shrine holds the key to your quest. But beware, the path to the shrine is perilous - spore-infested zombie ants and scorpions stand between you and your objective

boardgame.name: リスのタルトやさん (Risu no Tarte yasan)
boardgame.description:
The players take on the role of squirrels that live in the forest taking turns to collect resources to make tarts. At the end of a round, if a player has made three tarts, they are the winner.
Each round the players place their squirrels on trees or a tart pile to collect fruit or tart recipes, respectively. Large squirrels can gather two fruits, while small squirrels can only gather one. Once all the squirrels have been placed, they are collected back by the players and any tarts can be made, provided the player has the correct fruits and tart crust available.
In the beginning of each round, the fruit on the trees are refreshed from a bag, and new tart recipes are flipped over and play continues with a new first player.

boardgame.name: A Grandiose Disaster: The Dungeon of Doom Cards
boardgame.description:
This is a deck of pre-printed Scenario Cards for A Grandiose Disaster: The Dungeon of Doom, and requires that Scenario to play. Check out A Grandiose Disaster here.

A Grandiose Disaster is a Live Action Roleplaying Game where you play out your own character-centric disaster/horror movie! Using a set of structured scenarios, anywhere from 6 to 12 players play archetypical characters run through the wringer of the disaster. Who will you try to save? What choices do you make to survive?

Who lives, and who dies?

A Grandiose Disaster is written and designed by Mike Young and is published by ndpdesign.

boardgame.name: A Conspiracy of Ravens
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:

A Conspiracy of Ravens is a 36-page town-based DCC horror adventure for 0-level or 1st level characters.

A sinister blood fog surrounds the quiet town of Meadhan. Dark forms lurk in shadowy depths, innocent children turn into vicious winged beasts, and entranced villagers are being slaughtered on a giant instrument of death.

A Conspiracy of Ravens is a horror adventure town crawl that will challenge the players to use their wits, strength, and everything in between. Will you be able to survive the deceptive encounters and deadly creatures to save your friends and family?
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – Alternate Art Tattoo Artist
boardgame.description: This is a promo card with full alternative art
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game

boardgame.name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – Regionals 2013 Domain Cards
boardgame.description: Set of three double sided Domain cards. These are used instead of a facedown card from outside of the game.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game

boardgame.name: Codex: Hex
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:

Here's what you'll find inside Codex - Hex:

A Culture of Play: Conditions in The Between The Gauntlet has this incredible, unmatched play culture, and we wanted to find a way to incorporate that into the pages of Codex. We're going to do a series of articles called "A Culture of Play," which will examine gameplay, and offer play advice, from the perspective of someone who has run or played a game for many hours. Our hope is that these pieces will exist in the practical rather than the theoretical. The first entry in the series is about Conditions in The Between (Conditions being a sort of mechanical "hex" on a player character). If you have an idea for a piece in this series, please let us know!

Cutting Words This is a brand-new Trophy Gold incursion by James Smith, with (wicked) art by Chris Spence. We don't want to say too much about it so as not to spoil it, but let's just say it's a different perspective on dungeon crawling. We think you'll love it.

Inkeeryn's Illness This is a duet game by Dan Brown, with art by Marcus Jimenez. Like many of the standalone games we have published in Codex, it's about exploring a real-life topic through the medium of TTRPGs, in this case chronic illness.

Three Dozen Misfired Spells The latest entry in our legendary Miscellany series.

boardgame.name: Codex: Time 2
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:

This issue features a brand-new game by Chloé Germain, The Bureau of Irregularities; a new Trophy Gold incursion by Ben Bond and Matt Bond, Immemorial; Three Dozen MORE In Medias Res Starters; and a new Culture of Play feature, this time about pacing the Night Phase in The Between.

boardgame.name: Darkhouse
boardgame.description:
Darkhouse is a one page print and play roll and write game created by Garrett Sendlewski for the 2017 GenCant roll and write contest.

"Congratulations! Today is your first 30 hour shift working in the Darkhouse, the notorious upside down lighthouse that guides the ships that sail the underground sea. The head engineer gnome is on vacation, and it's up to you to cover his 30-hour shift and keep all the power gems in the Darkhouse energized. The job will test your physical and mental endurance! Survive your first day on the job, and your career is all but guaranteed!"

boardgame.name: Bretagne TT Version (Fan expansion for Ticket To Ride)
boardgame.description:
It’s 2120 and some Breton islands are now accessible by train thanks to floating bridges equipped with the latest technology. What will be the best strategy to connect the iconic places of Bretagne? Discover the surprises that some cities have in store for you, as well as new rules for the most adventurous players…

This game follows the same rules as the basic Ticket to Ride Europe game.
This extension offers the possibility to play with 5 additional rules, including Bonus cities, Special actions and Game variants. These additional rules were introduced to speed up the game and reduce the risk of "being blocked".

Great horizons and public objectives are among the new variants introduced.

Published by permission for non-commercial use. All rights to the Ticket to Ride™ name, gameplay, mechanics, and imagery are reserved by Days of Wonder, Inc., who have not endorsed or playtested this expansion.

---

Nous sommes en 2120 et certaines îles bretonnes sont désormais accessibles par train grâce à des ponts flottants dotés de la dernière technologie. Quelle sera la meilleure stratégie pour relier les lieux mythique dont regorge la Bretagne? Venez découvrir les surprises que vous réservent certaines villes, ainsi que de nouvelles règles pour les plus aventureux…

Ce jeu suit les mêmes règles que le jeu de base des Ticket to Ride Europe.
Cette extension offre la possibilité de jouer avec 5 règles supplémentaires, notamment les villes bonus, les actions spéciales et les variantes du jeu. Ces règles supplémentaires ont été introduites pour accélérer le jeu et réduire le risque de "blocage".

Grands horizons et objectifs publics font partie des nouvelles variantes introduites.

Publié pour une utilisation personnelle à des fins non commerciales. Tous les droits sur le nom, les mécanismes de jeu et l'imagerie des Aventuriers du Rail™ sont réservés à Days of Wonder, Inc, qui n'a pas approuvé ni testé cette extension.

boardgame.name: Raubbau
boardgame.description:
Raubbau (German for overexploitation) is thematically a dungeon crawler, mechanically it is a deduction and bluffing game, which provides significantly more depth than Skull, Poker or Liar's Dice. Special attention was paid to easy rules and intensive player interaction.

In Raubbau, each player only knows the treasures in his part of the ever-growing mine. If the treasures do not seem sufficiently precious, one can try to get an unknown treasure of another player by skillful deduction. The other players have the chance to react - but they are not forced to. If the other players react, one has to tax their reaction: Are they trying to trick you into awakening the dragon or is there a treasure hidden underneath their tile? A suspenseful atmosphere evolves while players try to trick each other.

Everybody wants to leave the mine, but nobody dares to, because another player might have more treasures. The player who assesses the other players and the situation in the mine best, will win the game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Imperium: Antyk/Legendy – Drewniana karta przesilenia
boardgame.description: Wooden solstice card, which can be used instead of the card from the game. Pre-order bonus to Polish edition of the game.

boardgame.name: Mercenaries of Charted Space
boardgame.description:
There is more to being a successful mercenary than fighting. A smart commander knows what to expect from the client and how far the can be trusted; how to go about obtaining recruits and weaponry, and who the opposition might be.

Mercenaries of Charted Space explores the details of the mercenary marketplace, from the Zhodani Consulate to the rimward fringes; from the Aslan Hierate to the Two Thousand worlds. The unique characteristics of each region are detailed, along with some of the dealers, agencies and notable mercenary forces found there... and an ongoing conflict to plunge right into.

Learn how to approach an Aslan noble with an offer of service, and what to expect in return; how to register with the Imperial authorities, and whether the Instellarm Million Credit Bond is worth the money. Be ready for the nightmarish machinations of a Hiver client, or the bizarre antics of Team Xtreme. Prepare for K'kree invasion in Gateway or join a desperate war of annihilation between two Aslan clans.

Mercenaries of Charted Space: Your guide to a successful and prosperous career in the Third Imperium and beyond.

boardgame.name: Specialist Forces
boardgame.description:
From the publishers webpage:
Specialist troops offer advantages the wise commander can exploit, or prevent the enemy from making use of their own advantages. Anti-armour and anti-aerospace specialists level the playing field for other troops, whilst recon experts provide vital information and commandos take advantage of it.

Specialist Forces presents information on these experts, along with rules governing their functions and equipment for their use. Mercenaries hope they will never be confronted with chemical or nuclear warfare, but if they are this volume has the necessary information. It also covers the operations of specialist formations ranging from armoured infantry to security formations and intelligence commandos.

The unique world of Starmercs is also explored, with information on the operations and equipment undertaken by forces whose primary asset is a starship. Modules for converting a conventional ship to a mercenary transport are presented, along with specialist mercenary tickets.

Inside you will find:

Special Operations and Special Forces
Combat Specialists
Reconnaissance and Stealth Specialists
Engineering and Heavy Weapons Specialists
Protected Forces
Non-combat Specialists
Security and Intelligence Specialists
Starmercs
Boarding Actions
Mercenary Vessels and Modules

Requires the use of the Mercenary box set

boardgame.name: Cat-Tastrophe!
boardgame.description:
Oh no! The cat's stuck up in the tree, and the firefighter can't get him down! It's a catastrophe!

Grab your handy pole and carefully push out the tree's pegs to help lower the feisty feline back down to Earth. But be careful: don't let kitty fall, or you lose!

boardgame.name: Looney Tunes: Looney Boom
boardgame.description:
Each player takes the role of a Looney Tunes character in a game of hot potato where the potato is an ACME bomb.
In these funny game, there is no winner, only one loser: the one who explode the bomb.
Every player takes turns trying to pass the bomb ahead without exploding, using several character abilities and, obviously, the ACME products.

boardgame.name: Epic Card Game: Pojedynek – Licznik Życia
boardgame.description: Life counter added as a pre-order bonus when ordering Polish edition of Epic Card Game: Duels.

boardgame.name: Mercenary Adventure 1: Verloren Hoop
boardgame.description:
From the publishers webpage:
The war for Medrealm is entering its final stages. As the balance tips ever further towards the Galian Federation, offworld mercenaries and their Medrealmer allies are trapped in the Rammline Pocket. Rumours abound that the Galians are not honouring repatriation bonds.

The nearest repatriation haven is hundreds of kilometres away, and evacuation by grav vehicle is not possible unless Galian aerospace interdiction can be evaded. The choice is between surrender and a desperate lunge up the Aix Valley to buy time for a desperate enterprise – a Verloren Hoop, or Forlorn Hope.

The Travellers are sent to infiltrate the high slopes of the Transaix Pass, collapsing the mountainside ahead of the advancing Galians. From there they are flung into battle, plugging a hole in the defensive line. With the situation stabilised they can begin the most dangerous phase of the operation. Success might open a window for evacuation, but the odds are stacked against the Travellers.

Requires the Mercenary box set.

boardgame.name: Politik
boardgame.description:
Politik is a dark strategy game of political, economic, and territory control for 2–6 players. Players represent 1 of 12 Nations who develop distinct identities during a struggle for global power. They introduce doctrines and choreograph propaganda campaigns. They hire talented leaders to conquer new states and swing elections. And they expand and improve companies to conquer markets and fill their coffers. A deck of 450+ unique cards provide the doctrines, propaganda, companies, assets, leaders, and events that each nation uses to forge its path.


Set just after the Great Collapse, the world is disoriented from decades of misinformation by the old regime. Entangled pirate signals fill the airwaves. Abandoned Imperial broadcast stations are commandeered to pipe out ideologies at high volume. Right and wrong blur together. There is no objective truth. No matter what is believed, only one nation will retake the throne.


Politik plays out simultaneously across 3 different arenas. Seizing control of 1 arena wins the game. Conquer states to control three of five regions of the Map for Military Victory. Rally bases of support to control four of six seats on the Council for Political Victory. Lead competitive companies to control four of six industries for Corporate Victory.


Along the road to victory, each arena offers distinct opportunities. Controlling states on the map increases resource production and card draw. Holding seats on the council adds game-changing benefits and abilities. Running effective companies boosts income. Opportunities, however, sometimes come with risks. Nations may embrace corruption to supercharge their strategies. But greed unchecked can lead to eventual demise.


Each turn, a player takes up to 2 actions from those available. Players can play cards from their hand by paying resource and capital costs. They can activate a card in play to use its special ability. They can clash in any arena to compete with other players for territory, political control or market share. They can research to draw more cards, recruit to draw or play leaders, campaign to gain power in the council, or buy and sell resources at prices that rise and fall throughout the game.


Four special actions, the national actions, come with limitations that players must manage carefully. A player must use every national action once before they can use any of them again. These powerful actions allow a player to produce resources from states under their control, rally support from the strength of their doctrines, gain income from their corporate activities, and refresh their cards in play to be used again.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Mercenary Adventure 2: Bug Hunt
boardgame.description:
From the publishers webpage:
The Pokoss are a destructive nuisance on Paradise of EI, but no more than that... until now. Their behaviour has changed, and security forces are calling for assistance. A mercenary unit is required to drive back an infestation of the creatures threatening Aldia City.

The situation is much worse than expected, with thousands of Pokoss marching towards the city devouring everything in their path. The city's leadership has staked everything on a defensive line held by inexperienced and amateurish militia.

Overwhelmed by the enormous numbers of Pokoss, the Travellers must coordinate a defence of the city against the external threat whilst dealing with inept superiors and unruly militia leaders. The city will have to be abandoned unless the mercenaries can turn the tide... and getting out might be just as difficult as defeating the Pokoss.

boardgame.name: Mercenary Adventure 3. Must Travel, Need Guns
boardgame.description:
From the back cover:
The planetary government of Kolan is one of 'those' clients. Prepared to pay a warfighter's fee, the rushed mercenaries up to the front and told them to wait for authorisation to act. And wait. And wait. Meanwhile the insurgents become ever more bold. Now the government wants to terminate the contract and withhold part of the fee for failing to fulfill the mission objectives.

The mercenaries need to demonstrate they would have made a good-faith attempt at the mission objectives had they not been hamstrung, but rules of engagement preclude offensive operations. The mercenaries are allowed to support patrols that come under attack, however, so with a little creativity they may have a pretext to pick a fight... and hopefully win it.

An unexpectedly hot engagement reveals the insurgents are receiving offworld support, including advanced weapons. The mercenaries have been ordered to withdraw, but the insurgents' base could be a threat to their retiring force. They are allowed to clear their flanks, but that would require raiding the insurgents' home base, defeating their forces and fulfilling the contract despite the client's intentions. And if they happen to seize a shipment of powerful weapons in the process... well, that is mere coincidence.

boardgame.name: Steam Battalions
boardgame.description:
Steam Battalions is a non-collectible, customized deck XCG, or Expandable Card Battle Game featuring stunning Steampunk & Dieselpunk art in which 2 players face-off against each other, each using a customized deck they create from their own Starter Deck at the beginning of the game. Each Starter Deck contains the same specific 68 cards, from which each player customizes their own deck down to 40 cards plus 3 "deck-diving" Armory Cards, as outlined in the Steam Battalions rulebook.

THE STORY:

In an alternate past, the great wars of the early 20th century are waging high above the clouds and across the mud-filled trenches of Europe. The armies of the World's Superpowers battle for supremacy with elite units forged in brass, iron and steel in a technological arms race powered by diesel and steam. You & your opponent create, customize & command your own elite Steam Battalions of Deck-Dueling Steampunk & Dieselpunk Dirigibles, Airships & Superheroes & send them into battle equipped with powerful Upgrades & Tech in the quest for Victory!

GAMEPLAY:

Steam Battalions is a fast-paced, 1-vs-1 Customized-Deck Dueling Steampunk Card Battle Game for ages 12 & up that takes approximately 30-45 minutes to play. The objective of the game is to be the first player to get 7 victory points (defeating 7 of your opponent’s unit cards in battle), or if your opponent has no units to move out from their trench, whichever comes first.

It features streamlined combat mechanics with a unique twist on "deck-diving" cards that deepens the strategy in ways unique from other card battle games. In Steam Battalions, you can only receive & play these special deck-diving "Armory" cards after you lose one of your units. This prevents either player from gaining an insurmountable lead during early gameplay & opens up new strategic choices you won't find in other card battle games.

Gameplay & deck-building mechanics are specifically designed to reduce the 'grinding' of most deck-dueling games while increasing the speed of the combat, customization, upgrades & strategy - all in a richly illustrated Steampunk & Dieselpunk world.


NOTE : Each player requires their own deck to play, so the game is sold as a complete two-player set of two starter decks. For even further customization, experienced players can purchase additional starter decks & may add cards from as many additional starter decks as they wish, subject to the deck customization rules outlined in the Steam Battalions Rulebook (free for download at link below).


—description from the designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Boss Monster: Portable Power Pack
boardgame.description: Expansion for Boss Monster 2: The Next Level that introduces the concept of portable rooms, allowing a player to take rooms they have built with a portable effect, and place it back in their hand during the Build Phase. The boss makes all rooms Portable.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Boss Monster: The Dungeon Building Card Game

boardgame.name: I Am Death Now?: Pain Expansion Pack
boardgame.description:
Deep in the forest of the Mythical Realm lurks a Researcher Death who hides behind a magical rock with his Death Clipboard to observe and take copious Death Notes. Soon he will venture further... Oh who bloody cares about the exposition, it's MYTHICAL PAIN TIME!

Using 18 new Mythical Pain cards you can inflict 1/2 pain to ANY category!

Also included: 15 more Pain cards, 2 new Test Subjects and 11 new Cheat Cards!

Plus, you can now add a 6th player. That means Kenneth can play now!

boardgame.name: Field Commander's Pack
boardgame.description:
From the Kickstarter:
In the Field Commander's Pack, you will find:

A pad of blank Mercenary Unit Roster sheets, ready for your new unit
Six Mercenary pencils, perfect for your Travellers
One Mercenary Officer's pen, because referees are worth it
The Enemy Vehicle Recognition Pack, 24 postcard-sized aids picturing and detailing the most dangerous vehicles you are likely to meet on the battlefield - and should be on your unit's shopping list
A boxed set of 20 brand new Mercenary dice
The Premium Weapons Guide, a 24 page addition to the Field Catalogue featuring items made available only to the finest of mercenary units

boardgame.name: Barbarossa: Kickstarter Promos
boardgame.description:
Part of these were also stretch goals in the Kickstarter campaign.

The set contains the following cards:

P02 - Fraulein Kleist
P03 - Li'l Rundstedt
P04 - Li'l Fuhrer
P06 - Further Reinforcements x2
P07 - Li'l Hoth
P11 - Grenadier Regiment (Cosplay Alternate Art)
P12 - Panzer Grenadier Regiment (Cosplay Alternate Art)

boardgame.name: El Alamein: Kickstarter Promo Cards
boardgame.description:
This is a promotional pack of cards released for El Alamein as part of the Kickstarter.

It contains 4 cards:

P04 - Airfield
P06 - Das Boat
34A - Minsk
35A - Rostov

boardgame.name: Vedelsz vagy Mersz?
boardgame.description:
Do you drink or dare you? Drinking card game.

"Are you brave?" your new favorite drinking game! This game brings strangers closer together, can break friendships that have lasted for years, and has even helped some people get pregnant. If you’re looking for a game that makes you laugh so much that your tears flow out and you want to get to know the side of others you didn’t know about yet, look no further. The best part is that you probably won’t remember what happened the next day.

How to play:

Shuffle the cards and place them in the middle of the table. The youngest player starts and then moves clockwise. The first player draws the top card and then completes the task on it. If you do not want to, you must drink the amount indicated on the card. Then the next player draws and so on.

Whoever completes the most challenges by the end of the night will be the winner of the game.

Only +18 and up!

boardgame.name: WatchList
boardgame.description:
One of our high-level deep cover agents has been compromised. Certain individuals have obtained information of their whereabouts and are even now, looking to exchange this for monetary compensation.
Your mission is to make sure they do not do so.
Our asset has limited vision and means of communication, but it is vital you work with the asset to find the counter-informants.
Save our informant before the time runs out!

WatchList is a real-time cooperative game. The team search for counter-informants by asking YES or NO questions to their informant. Observe the details of the cards and be descriptive with your questions to quickly identify your targets. Players win if they can find all the counter-informants before the time runs out!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Federico da Montefeltro
boardgame.description:
Idea and goal of the game

Players shall compete by developing the duchy of Federico in a fun game for 2-5 players.
Your goal is building districts, combining the most significant works that history has left us, in order to earn points. During the game, you will also leverage the skills of prominent historical dignitaries for opportunities, and events to hinder your opponents.

boardgame.name: MITRYS
boardgame.description: Mitrys is a fantasy adventure game based on the Dual Realm Universe (Mitrys Trilogy). Players take role of one of the heroes: Shaman, Assassin, Druid or Warrior. They compete with each other using characters' various advantages. Player wins, when completes the Mission from the Mystery Card. During the game many adventures awaits: treasures, friends and foes. The battles are resolved by rolling the dice. Players will gain experience and will improve their statistics. Collecting spells, items, acquiring companions or learning new skills is also a thing. Sometimes it can pay off to make a small alliance or sabotage the actions of other players. No gameplay is the same. You don't have to read the trilogy to be able to play, but knowing the plot and atmosphere of the universe doubles the pleasure :)

boardgame.name: Battle of Midway
boardgame.description:
In Battle for Midway players will have the opportunity to take on the role of an American or Japanese air force commander and become a participant in the famous Battle of Midway of 1942, which decided the fate of the war in the Pacific. The game is for two players and its duration depends on the adopted Game Mode.

The war game with COBI bricks combines strategy requiring planning with random elements. The pawns are mini models of block planes on special bases. Every player will easily master extremely simple game rules based on clear icons. The set includes a box, a game board consisting of seven large and two small pieces, 12 airplanes on special stands, action cards, tokens and markers. The included sticker sheet lets players personalize their planes!

Perfectly balanced tactical and random elements make the gameplay exciting every time. Players of all ages can easily duel with each other! Devise clever strategies or let your luck run wild! Feel the atmosphere of the Second World War clash thanks to the amazing graphics. Lead your air fleet to victory!

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Something Fishy
boardgame.description:
The ocean world holds you, the solo King of the reef, the job of keeping the reef full but not too full. As fish show up you tell them where to reside, sneakily putting together groups of the same fishes so they will leave and make a home elsewhere. You only have this position for a short time, and then one of the other fish will take this responsibility. Don't let the reef get too crowded or you fail and the reef falls to decay.

In Something Fishy, a solo mostly abstract game, the player takes the position of Reef King. The job that is placed on each King is to maintain a balance of fishes. Fish tokens are drawn randomly, two each turn. The player will roll three dice to indicate where the tokens may be placed. The player take two of the rolled dice, add them together, forming a number of an area to place the token.
Each area of the reef, has 1-2 numbers that correspond to it, providing an overlap for each number, so each area has two groups of numbers for placement, kind of like a Venn diagram with "lanes" that hold three fish each, and an area consisting of two lanes that overlap to the left and right groups of numbers as well.
If, after the two fish tokens are placed, eachv area is checked for three or more fishes of the same color; those fish tokens are taken off the board and placed to the side, making more room for others "arriving". If, after 24 turns and the reef areas have not been overran by having three fish in one lane, you win. If, after checking for full lanes, and removal of the threes that are duplicates, a lane is still full with three tokens, you lose.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Furnace: Interbellum
Индустрия: Интербеллум
boardgame.description:
Furnace expands into the twenties and thirties of the twentieth century — the interwar period known as the interbellum. In this expansion, you will find new Company cards and Capitalists, new abilities, Manager tokens, variable Capital discs, a set of components for a fifth player, and new Agents for two-player and single-player games. All of this exists within beautiful industrial buildings and structures from the epoch of Art Deco, Constructivism, and Bauhaus.

Interbellum is designed for players who are already familiar with Furnace. The expansion is best played if all of its elements are added to the base game, but if you don’t feel up to it, you can get to know it piece by piece.

boardgame.name: Matik
boardgame.description:
A puzzle game that requires tactical planning and reacting to the actions of the opponents.

During one game, each participant will perform only 9 actions. Therefore, it is worth considering each play carefully, especially since the opponents are only counting on your error. Fast gameplay, tactical decisions and a strategic approach to the moves made - this is Matik!

HOW TO PLAY ?

Add a tile or a pawn to the board.
Watch the movements of the other players.
Earn points for tiles next to your pawns.


Gra logiczna wymagająca taktycznego planowania oraz reagowania na poczynania przeciwników.

W trakcie jednej gry każdy z uczestników rozgrywki wykona jedynie 9 akcji. Warto zatem dobrze przemyśleć każde zagranie, zwłaszcza, że przeciwnicy tylko liczą na Twój błąd. Szybka rozgrywka, taktyczne decyzje i strategiczne podejście do wykonywanych ruchów – to właśnie Matik!

JAK GRAĆ ?


Dołóż na planszę kafelek lub pionek.
Obserwuj ruchy pozostałych graczy.
Zdobywaj punkty za kafelki przy swoich pionkach.

boardgame.name: Battle of Money Exchange: You can well understand system of foreign exchange!?
boardgame.description:
For currency exchange, whether it goes up or down, there are good and bad sides to it.
First, there is a gap between rich and poor countries, and everyone wants to import from the wealthy countries.
Therefore, people all over the world buy the currency of the wealthy country.
As a result, the price of the currency rises.
As the price rises, it becomes harder and harder to buy.
In such a situation, if there is another country that can produce the product at a lower price, everyone will buy it there, and the products of the country that used to sell well will no longer sell well.
I made a game out of such a mechanism.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Schattenkompendium
Sixth World Companion
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Dream it, be it

The Sixth World is wild and weird, but it doesn’t have to be wilder or weirder than you.

If you can dream it, the Sixth World Companion helps you play it. With alternate character creation methods, new metatypes, a whole slew of qualities, and even some rules variations, Sixth World Companion brings dozens of options to your game table for you to build your vision of what your runner should be.

Sixth World Companion is the core player resource book for Shadowrun, Sixth World.

boardgame.name: Draft Scout
boardgame.description:
4 years later, The-Magical-Star once every 10,000 years arrives in Japan.
As the approaching, the people have magical power, they have be able to use black magic.
So, it was decided to hold the "National High School Black Magic Golem Championship".
You have been appointed by the principal as a team manager.
Train your students, scout great students and win the Championship 4 years from now!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Black Tail's Panda Slayer
boardgame.description:
This is the country of panda plush toys.
In recent years, King Panda, who has been hurt his heart by the pandas with the wrong tail color, has finally enforced the "Black-Tail-Slaying-Law".
This made it legal to tear off the black tail.

However, the black tail force is deep-rooted, and even in the black tail slayers unit formed by volunteers, the black tail is secretly mixed.
Hide and cheat on your own black tail, blame the other black tail severely, and with the cooperation of bears and red pandas, let's regain the appearance of giant pandas as it should be!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Neo-Tokyo Drift
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Rev Your Engine!

A big race is coming up, and a lot of people want to win it, as there is both money and prestige on the line. The runners are asked to help arrange for a particular winner of the race, but soon others come in with a competing offer. The runners have to decide who to help, who to anger, and just how they’ll make sure their selected target wins.

SRM 09-04 Neo-Tokyo Drift is dual-statted for use with both Shadowrun, Fifth Edition and Shadowrun, Sixth World.

boardgame.name: Hour of Need: Jade Kid
boardgame.description:
This Kickstarter Exclusive expansion was given to backers as a free gift for pledging for the campaign.

The box contains 2 miniatures representing her as a hero or a bystander. It also includes a hero deck, a card divider, and a bystander card.

boardgame.name: Die Legenden von Andor: Die Ewige Kälte
boardgame.description:
The whole country of Andor is suffering from an unnatural cold.

In four epic legends in Die Legenden von Andor: Die Ewige Kälte, a team of 2-4 heroes embarks on an exciting journey to a strange land beyond the mountains. On a new, double-sided game board, you'll find loyal allies and face unexpected dangers. Together you will find out who is behind the magical threat of the eternal cold!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Hour of Need: Stretch Goals
boardgame.description:
This box contains all the stretch Goals Unlocked during the Kickstarter campaign for Hour of Need.

The box contains:


Fault miniature, her Hero deck and divider
Lox Lee miniature, nemesis card and divider
4 translucent Curtain Call miniatures and 1 crisis card
Acrid miniature, villain deck, divider card, and 4 translucent lackey miniatures
Timeframe miniature and ally card

boardgame.name: Código Secreto: Expansão promocional Brasil
boardgame.description: This promo pack is produced by Devir and has 10 cards with 20 new words from Brazilian Portuguese.

boardgame.name: Regine
boardgame.description:
Regine is a card game of betting and bluffing, designed by Dani Gómez and Josep M Allué, the author of games like The Color Monster, Castellers!, and Dragons & Chickens. It is illustrated by Bea Tormo. It’s for 2 to 4 players ages 10 and up and games last around 30 minutes. Regine brings us back to the European courts of the end of the 16th century and the goal is to be the first player to reach 31 points.

Watch your backs…because the daggers are flying! In Regine the interaction among players is constant and the majority of the effects of the cards affect the hands of your rivals. As the game progresses, each player tries to get the best combinations to score points but they don’t always have control over their hands.

The intuitive card design makes it quick and easy to learn how they function. And if you know how to play Mus, some of the rules will seem familiar. Rounds are structured in 3 phases: hand construction in which players try to get the most favorable card combinations, a betting phase where they bid on the best hands, and point resolution. To start, put the 4 scoring cards in the middle of the table alongside the betting chits. Shuffle the remaining 40 cards, deal 4 face down to each player, and put the rest in the middle of the table. You’re now ready to start the first phase!

In a turn, a player can do 1 of 4 actions. The first is change one of the cards in their hand for the top card of the deck. The second is to announce “no changes,” which blocks the rest of the players from changing cards from the deck. The third is play a card either face down or face up on the table. If a card is placed face up, it may trigger an action. The jester, for example, negates a “no changes” declaration previously made by another player. The peasant forces a player to play a card face up on the table and use its effect. The assassin eliminates a card that has been played on the table, the courtesan forces a player to reveal a card that has been played face down, the herald lets one look at the top card of the deck and the knight forces one to change a card from their hand. Finally, each player can also pass and when all players pass, all remaining cards are placed face down and the betting phase begins.

Be sharp and observant, because it’s now time to bluff! Taking turns, the players will bet on the scoring cards. They’ll bet on the highest number of queens and jesters, on pairs and trios of cards, and for the total value of their cards. It’s not always necessary to have the best hand in order to score points! You can always trick the other players into thinking you have better hand than you really do. In the last phase, the resolution, all cards are revealed and points are awarded. Rounds continue like this until a player reaches 31 points.

A good memory and a big dose of shrewdness will be your best allies in Regine, ensuring quick games and hours of fun. Families and friends, young and old will enjoy this game (try playing with your grandparents or card playing in-laws and they’ll quickly get the knack). So move with caution among the knights and courtesans and don’t get caught with the wrong cards!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Grohog Clan
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:


Grohog Clan is a Low - Mid Level scenario and not a full fledged adventure that can be used as a one-off or a side quest....



Simply put ... A band of Gnolls have made the area their new home and the villagers want theme taken care of....

Designed for use with Old School Essentials RPG by Necrotic Gnome

This is also OSR - B/X Comapt.

boardgame.name: Mazescape Cryo-C
boardgame.description:
Mazescape is a clever and fascinating maze game for one player that will challenge even the most active minds. The Cryo-C version is designed by Pablo Céspedes and Victor Hugo Cisternas, authors of Tesoros del Rey Pirata, and illustrated by David Yuyo Correa.

When the mainframe computer of the supply ship unexpectedly awakens from suspended animation, something’s probably going to go wrong. You’re still in outer space, there’s nobody by your side, and the central reactor’s alarm won’t stop sounding. Upon exiting your capsule you realize that everyone else has disappeared. Who, or better yet, what has taken them? To find out, sharpen your wits, patience and powers of observation.

The Mazescape saga introduces a completely unique concept that fans of logic and puzzles will love. In this original game from Devir, you will place a map on the table and look for the compass rose as the starting point of the maze. Using the wooden styles that comes with the game, you’ll trace the white pathways, maintaining contact with the maze at all times, and you’ll open and close sections of the map while looking for the exit point of the Impossible Triangle. Pass under bridges, climb staircases, and keep your head from spinning until the exit point takes you to the next scenario.

Each Mazescape box contains seven different challenges to face. The first maze is a relatively accessible challenge, and little by little the mazes become increasingly difficult until the final elegant explosion of pathways, which can only be untangled by the sharpest minds.

Moreover, each map includes a series of secondary challenges that allow you to travel through a second time, giving each set of maps a high degree of re-playability. Look for all of the hidden treasures in the seven maps. And the portable format is easy to play anywhere; all you need is a place to set the map and the stylus to start your journey. But beware, nobody said that escaping from the labyrinth would be easy!

Mazescape Cryo-C offers the most advanced challenges of the Mazescape saga, including the most complex mazes to date. Are you up for the challenge?

boardgame.name: Código Secreto: Expansão promocional Portugal
boardgame.description: This promo pack is produced by Devir and has 10 cards with 20 new words from Portuguese.

boardgame.name: Mazescape Hipnos
boardgame.description:
Mazescape is a clever and fascinating maze game for one player that will challenge even the most active minds. The Hypnos set is designed by Pablo Céspedes and Victor Hugo Cisternas, authors of Tesoros del Rey Pirata, and illustrated by Celeste Carvajal.

Just before bedtime, as you are on the border of dreamland, a light surprises you from the corner of your bedroom. Colorful clouds form on the ceiling and slowly form shapes before your eyes. Not understanding how or why, you’ve found yourself in the dreamlike world of Hypnos. Find your way out! To do so, sharpen your wits, patience and powers of observation.

The Mazescape saga introduces a completely unique concept that fans of logic and puzzles will love. In this original game from Devir, you will place a map on the table and look for the compass rose as the starting point of the maze. Using the wooden styles that comes with the game, you’ll trace the white pathways, maintaining contact with the maze at all times, and you’ll open and close sections of the map while looking for the exit point of the Impossible Triangle. Pass under bridges, climb staircases, and keep your head from spinning until the exit point takes you to the next scenario.

Each Mazescape box contains seven different challenges to face. The first maze is a relatively accessible challenge, and little by little the mazes become increasingly difficult until the final elegant explosion of pathways, which can only be untangled by the sharpest minds.

Moreover, each map includes a series of secondary challenges that allow you to travel through a second time, giving each set of maps a high degree of re-playability. Look for all of the hidden treasures in the seven maps. And the portable format is easy to play anywhere; all you need is a place to set the map and the stylus to start your journey. But beware, nobody said that escaping from the labyrinth would be easy!

Mazescape Hipnos is the Mazescape version designed specially for kids. Simple challenges for the whole family, with a difficulty level specially adjusted for +6 years old players!

boardgame.name: Catstronauts
boardgame.description:
As the Commander of a team of Catstronauts, you’ll take on fast-paced missions to visit planets across the solar system and rescue poor helpless kittens!

From the designers of Kittin, Catstronauts is a family speed and sequence game where players race to match their numbered catstronauts to each of the planet cards in the correct order.

With 16 ‘meeples’ that can be customized with 16 unique cat face stickers, players can build their purr-fect team of expert Catstronauts.

Catstronauts comes in the same small tin you expect and love from Kittin!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Stillfleet Regras Quickstart v2.1
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Stillfleet é um novo RPG de mesa sobre explorar espaçonaves arruinadas—destroços—e planetas habitáveis análogos à Terra, sem contato com a Terra por décadas ou séculos—pedras.

Jogadores assumem os papéis de “froteiros”—exploradores e mineradores siderais trabalhando para a Venerável Companhia de Froteiros, mais conhecida como a Companhia, ou CF (Companhia de Froteiros). O lar deles, a estação espacial apelidada de Fuso—imagine uma lesma marinha de pedra preta ondulada com quilômetros de altura—é um mistério para os próprios habitantes. Ainda por cima, o lugar é repleto de portais espaço-temporais chamados trambolhos, muitos dos quais já estão amarrados a mundos habitáveis…

Este Quickstart contém mais de setenta páginas de regras, aliens, cenários e tabelas aleatórias, além de um documento separado com oito Personagens Prontas—todas de classes e espécies diferentes.

O sistema de regras de Stillfleet é único e super flexível. Nós o testamos com jogadores de RPGs old-school, novatos, fãs de sci-fi, e transeuntes aleatórios.

Se você gostar deste Quickstart, nos apoie no Patreon, assine nossa lista de e-mail, siga-nos no Instagram e no Twitter, e junte-se a nós no nosso Discord! Nós vamos lançar novos módulos logo, no processo de compor o Livro Básico.

boardgame.name: Die Legenden von Andor: Big Box
boardgame.description:
Legends of Andor is a co-operative adventure board game for two to four players in which a band of heroes must work together to defend a fantasy realm from invading hordes. To secure Andor's borders, the heroes will embark on dangerous quests over the course of five unique scenarios (as well as a final scenario created by the players themselves). But as the clever game system keeps creatures on the march toward the castle, the players must balance their priorities carefully.

At the heart of Legends of Andor is its unique narrative, the linked scenarios of which tell an overarching story as the players successfully complete objectives. For each scenario, or "Legend", a legend deck conveys the plot of an ever-unfolding tale...one in which the players are the protagonists. A wooden marker moves along the board's legend track at key points during each scenario, triggering the draw of a new legend card, the introduction of new game-altering effects, and the advancement of the story's plot. In the end, the players must endeavor to guide the fate of Andor through their heroic actions, bringing a happy ending to their epic fantasy tale.

Die Legenden von Andor: Big Box includes the Legends of Andor base game, the New Heroes expansion that allows for games with up to six players, a promo "Wolf Warrior" hero, and additional legends on top of those in the base game.

boardgame.name: Cyber Seeds: Collection 04
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Oy, budzo! Are you running a game of Cyberpunk, Shadowrun, Carbon 2185, The Sprawl, or something similar? Sometimes you need a quick story for your players. Not a complete campaign, or even an adventure, but something you can modify to fit your table. You need a Cyber Seed.

DRP Cyber Seed Collections feature two different ideas complete enough to build a session around, yet open enough that you can add/change details, and make it your own. Use them as-is, flesh them out, or use just the description as the base of your own adventure.

This system-agnostic collection includes:

Keishi is a cybered-up merc. This time, her handlers want her find find a black site, but she's not really sure she wants to kill the citizens living above it
Someone has found a way to counterfeit cash, corp scrip, and digital credits. Apparently the aim to to destabilize the West's recovering economy. Help!

boardgame.name: Tavern Menu Generator
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tired of eating the same thing over and over again at the tavern? Spice up your meals with this full course Tavern Menu Generator!

This product contains:

a printable black and white cover page,
6 tables of 6 to 20 items, for each part of the meal (drink, snack, appetizer, soup, main dish and dessert)

boardgame.name: A Man's Word
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Not everything is always as it appears, and nothing could be more accurate when stumbling upon this bloody scene. A lone survivor, his life slowly leaking out, asks for aid hesitantly when the party arrives. But looking around, the truth seems not to be within the words shared about the deadly confrontation. To discover what really happened will take some detective work to piece the clues together.

A Man’s Word is a Q-Encounter, or Quick-Encounter, that can be run for a group of four to six players with 3rd-level characters and higher. This encounter would be considered a ‘medium’ to ‘hard’ encounter.

boardgame.name: Cult of Sol
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mystery cults are secret societies that exist within religious institutions. Like other secret societies, their existence is well known, but their rituals, lore, and objectives are concealed. Only the initiated are allowed access to these secrets.

This file provides an overview of mystery cults and specific details about the Cult of Sol, one of the most important goddesses in the Amazons vs Valkyries setting.

Features:

Sample cult secrets
The location of Sol's shrines
Festivals held in Sol's honor
Cleric's Voyages Domain
Paladin's Oath of the Dawn Bringer

boardgame.name: Bau Simulator 2012
Bau-Simulator 2012
Construction Simulator 2012
boardgame.description:
Step in the shoes of a real construction worker with all it needs to set up small, mid-sized and big buildings. In the Construction Simulator 2012 you have the possibility to take all the steps it needs for the construction of those buildings yourself. Heave the base of a small garage with a mini-digger or cast the concrete of your neighborhood’s new elementary school. Get behind the wheel of an angledozer and compress the base for a new parking lot. Or just transport pallets of roof tiles to the site…

If you ever dreamt of driving a telescopic crane or a flat bed truck – then this simulation is also something for you. Next to working on all important steps of a construction, you will have the chance to check out a huge fleet of realistic vehicles. No matter if you want to drive a wheel-loader, digger or regular truck – all machines will excite you with their performance.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Aventuria: Der Regenbogenfall Teamherausforderung
boardgame.description:
Face the forces of nature with your friends! With the blessings of the twelve gods, together you can prevent a catastrophe. Walk together on sacred paths and discover the legendary Rainbowfall on the Cyclops Islands. Don't let evil rule the fortunes of this miracle!

Together with the Aventuria basic box, this cooperative challenge can be experienced with up to 20 players. If you want it particularly exciting, you can also play this adventure with several groups at the same time.

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: Gallia MMXX SZEREPJÁTÉK SZABÁLYOK NYERSEN, SZÁLKÁSAN SZABÁLYKIVONAT
boardgame.description:
"Rules raw, filamentous:
"In any case, we took it back from the joke, and we discussed the rules of the Gallia MMXX role-playing game objectively and infinitely in the pages of the rule supplement."

If you’re the kind of role-player who likes to learn about the specifics of a system and world first, and only then cut into the game, then this publication is for you!
We have significantly shortened the rules in the charter and added a summary of qualifications so that it can be rotated comfortably.
And if you have any questions about the rule at the table, you can quickly find them here!"

-Translated Hungarian Text
boardgame.rpgitemversion: Gallia MMXX SZEREPJÁTÉK SZABÁLYOK NYERSEN, SZÁLKÁSAN SZABÁLYKIVONAT

boardgame.name: Construction Simulator 2015
Construction Simulator 2015 Gold Edition
Construction Simulator Deluxe Edition
boardgame.description:
Construction Simulator: Deluxe Edition includes the full version of the simulation hit, all previously released expansions, and more!

19 realistic construction vehicles, including original machines and trucks manufactured by Liebherr, MAN, and STILL, as well as various trailers for the true-to-life MAN tractor truck are all included together in one package for the first time in the Gold Edition. The already extensive motor pool of the core game has been significantly expanded with the Liebherr LB 28 drilling rig, complete with new functions, as well as the Liebherr LR 1300 crawler crane, the Liebherr 150 EC-B flat top crane, and the escort vehicle for heavy loads.

In this game, the developers have paid special attention to creating a game with a realistic feel, whether the player is working on projects or operating vehicles. You can, for example, operate a digger with two joysticks using SAE controls!

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: A Fistful of Flowers
boardgame.description:
'Publisher Blurb'

When a stuffy noblewoman decides that leshys make for pretty centerpieces for her fancy tea party, she has no idea what sort of trouble she's stirring up. Not every plant in the forest wants to be put on display, and some of them are more than well-equipped to fight for those who are plucked from their homes!

In A Fistful of Flowers, you take on the role of one of four unique leshys—plants who have been granted sapience and wills of their own. When new sproutlings are snatched out of the woods and taken away to civilization, it's up to your band of furious flowers and pugilistic plants to set things right!

A Fistful of Flowers is a short adventure for 3rd-level characters that takes a band of leshy heroes out of the forest and into that most dangerous of locations—an aristocrat's fancy tea party. In addition, the four pregenerated characters provide a quick way to jump into the adventure right away in this exciting offering for Free RPG Day! Grab some dice and some friends and play the role of the forest's newest heroes!

boardgame.name: Pathfinder Flip-Tiles: Fortress Chambers Expansion
boardgame.description:
24 double-sided 6" x 6" color map tiles to expand castles or fortresses with armories, barracks, bedrooms, chambers, dining rooms, fountains, guard posts, kitchens, and throne rooms.

Wet, dry, and permanent marker erasable.

Expands the Fortress starter set and compatible with Fortress walls & towers.

boardgame.name: Combined Arms: The World War II Campaign Game
boardgame.description:
Bolt Action - Combined Arms is a strategic board game that commands the players to face off, seize the initiative and outwit their foe amidst the fog of war. Each game will see you fighting for control of air, land, and sea in order to claim objectives and hold them against the enemy.

Choose your theatre of war, from the western and eastern fronts to North Africa and the Pacific. Each theatre has its own challenges and opportunities, some rewarding control over the sea, some rewarding control over the skies. How many of your precious resources will you sink into each, and how much will be left to control the land? Will you rely on stealth as you move units secretly, springing up where you are least suspected, or will you attempt to overwhelm your enemy with brutal overkill?

Combined Arms can be played as a stand-alone game or players can incorporate Bolt Action, Blood Red Skies, Cruel Seas, or Victory at Sea for an epic continent-spanning campaign. Unique cards link your campaign with your chosen wargames, meaning your choices in the campaign could mean victory or defeat on the tabletop.

This box contains:

Rules booklet
4 game maps covering Northwest Europe, The Eastern Front, North Africa and The Pacific theatres of operation.
Orders Board
Operations Board
6 Card decks
67 Tokens
Plastic Army markers
Plastic Objectives

-description from publisher's website
boardgame.boardgameintegration: Blood Red Skies: Battle of Britain
Victory at Sea: Battle for the Pacific
Blood Red Skies: Battle of Britain
Victory at Sea: Battle for the Pacific

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Amazons vs Valkyries: Optional Rules
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This PDF collects all the optional rules for the Amazons vs Valkyries setting into one file. These options include all the published rules and plus more rules collected from upcoming titles. These rules include:

Intelligence (Engineering) proficiency
Intelligence (War) proficiency
Interrogating NPC prisoners
Flying Mounts!
Rules for noise (how far can you hear a scream?)
Expanded Swimming Rules
New Conditions (most are from Poisonous Plants)
If you're playing an Amzons vs Valkyries campaign, these alternate rules are essential. If you are playing another fantasy campaign, these rules will still help your game run better!

boardgame.name: Derelict Cruisers Part V: Ancient Jewels
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:
