A dark ultra-short sci-fi derelict space-ship adventure-seed.

The adventurers discover a completely turned off ship, drifting through space. When they enter, everything is covered with ice and frost, the engines drained – but the crew is nowhere to be found.

This is a small booklet (6 paged PDF-file) with a small sci-fi adventure seed. The GameMaster needs to flesh out NPC:s, add proper values (depending on what rule system you use) and perhaps create maps etc.

The adventure is fast/short and linear - but with a nice detective mystery to be solved. It can end with simply solving the mystery - or death to all involved!

boardgame.name: Arms and Artifacts of Zul: Magic Items Tome II
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the mythical World of Zul, swords and sorcery are the keys to battling monsters and ungodly extraplanar creatures, claiming the riches of ages, and forging new empires. In "Arms and Artifacts of Zul: Tome II," you'll find the stuff, and treasures, of legend: the magical sword of a privateer and sea-rover; an ancient religious artifact with the power to summon geniekind and other wondrous beings; and the enchanted ring of a crime lord, possessing a shady past and shady powers.

"Arms and Artifacts of Zul: Tome II:" part of a series that introduces magical items unique to the "World of Zul" and "Free City of Vadashar" campaign settings for Dungeons and Dragons 5th Edition. Included is a brief history of the Free City of Vadashar, plus item descriptions, and more.

boardgame.name: Oldskull Steading Companion
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fee, fie, foe, fum,
I smell the blood of a Grimrookman.
Be he alive, or be he dead,
I’ll grind his bones to make my bread.

In 1978, E. Gary Gygax begin writing dungeon modules to be published by TSR. These adventure scenarios and fascinating settings became classics, and now decades later stand firmly established within the old school subculture of fantasy role-playing.

The brevity of these releases left many players and readers wanting more. Sequels and reimagined works have been published by others many times, but no one seems to ever go back to the master’s original sources to figure out where many of the mysteries actually arose in prior centuries.

The Oldskull Companion series features detailed new lore from the author’s World of Oldskull campaign, as well as deeply-researched aspects drawn from folklore, weird fiction, fairytales, medieval sagas, and world mythology. The Oldskull Steading Companion is all about hill giants, their ways, their weapons, their treasures, their allies, and their secrets.

In this volume you will find dozens of monster archetypes, giant name generators, giant’s bag randomizers, World of Oldskull lore, and treasure details that will enrich your old school campaign with additional options that flow seamlessly into the existing body of hill giant lore. Using this tome you can turn hill giants and their allies into unforgettable foes with their own culture, secrets, and deadly tactics.

boardgame.name: Pilot's Course
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Pilot’s Course is intended to give some background ideas on starship operation and procedures for referees. If your player characters have a ship, this will give you ideas on bridge and watch-keeping procedures, as well as communications. How does artificial gravity steer the ship? How do you know where you are? How do you tell someone else? What information does a transponder send out? How do you make sure the people maintaining the laser turret don’t get electrocuted? It will help you to make starship operation seem convincing to your players.

It also includes details of the Euthenia Training Shuttle and the Fortuna Armoured Courier, with deck plans and statistics. There’s also artwork and Voithea, an AI crew member.

boardgame.name: Arcadia: Planetary Amusement & Recreation Kingdom
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

No one remembers when Arcadia became the go-to planet for family fun. Time out of mind has passed since there was much on the planet's surface besides the P.A.R.K. Every hour of every day of every week, every month, and every year, Arcadia's employees keep attractions, shops, eateries, and more greased and running at high capacity. Just don't mention HR around them, or they get skittish.

The Arcadia: Planetary Amusement & Recreation Kingdom setting is a resource for tabletop RPG gamers to use in their weird/cosmic horror games and is entirely system-agnostic. Take your group to "The P.A.R.K." and they'll never forget the journey!

The Arcadia setting was created by the Arium player community using the Ennie-nominated worldbuilding rules in Arium: Create. Although the setting is system-agnostic, we recommend giving it a spin with our streamlined roleplaying ruleset, Arium: Discover!

boardgame.name: Hazard: Tropical Cyclone!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The warnings go out long before the disturbance appears, but the scene belies the urgency of the alert: the air is warm, the sky is blue, the winds are light, large puffy clouds float over the beachgoers, and even the seabirds don’t seem too concerned.

A day later, all of that has changed. The air is almost oppressively humid, the sky is taking on a more ominous cast as a wall of clouds seem to gather on the horizon. The wind is picking up and driving ever-increasing wave activity, and the seabirds are suddenly silent and absent. The day after that all hell is about to break loose as the approaching storm brings danger in the form of deadly winds, catastrophic flooding, and even the occasional tornado.

And those who ignored the warnings will soon come to regret doing so.

A tropical cyclone is an atmospheric system characterized by a rapid rotation of air masses around a low-pressure center, strong winds, and spiral bands of thunderstorms producing heavy rains. On Earth, cyclones go by several names, depending on where they occur: hurricane, typhoon, tropical cyclone, or simply cyclone. All describe the same type of storm.

Hazard: Tropical Cyclone! allows the Referee to challenge hir Players with the unstoppable and unpredictable combined wrath of the sea and the sky. This file, though short, is packed with a discussion of how cyclones form, their characteristics, abilities, superlatives, and game stats.

Hazard: Tropical Cyclone! If the wind doesn’t get you, the water will.

boardgame.name: The Black Bull
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An original short bounty hunt for 1st- to 2nd-level characters

Local villagers have contracted a spiritual malaise, telling stories of an evil monster that recently appeared. The adventurers are asked by a priestess to investigate and stop this accursed beast.

boardgame.name: Goons: Survival Kit Expansion
boardgame.description: Expand GOONS with 2 more unique Villains! Do you dare spin the lucky wheel of Ol’e Jist or try the Vicar’s Schemes that slowly builds up? The expansion also includes 2 new Goons and 6 new Item Cards!

boardgame.name: Part Of The Problem
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ten years ago, the world collapsed. Most people blame EMPs and/or nuclear weapons for the collapse of society. The truth is that no one is quite sure. It isn’t like anyone can turn on the news to find out. On that day, nearly all modern electronic devices simply stopped working, along with the power grid and every other utility.

Cities are shells of their former glory. Some people still eke out an existence there salvaging what they can find in the ruins, but most have chosen to retreat and create villages reminiscent more of the Middle Ages than the digital age.

The members of your group are part of a local village that is lucky enough to have an old piece of heavy equipment that is still functional and has been modified to run on biodiesel.
However, it needs a part or it will not be able to be used during the upcoming planting season. Your job is to head into the city of Sutterville and try to locate what the mechanic needs. He gives you the broken part and shows you where it came from so you know what you need. The village mechanic is far too valuable to travel with you.

Included with this short adventure is an 8 1/2" x 11" copy of the floorplan, Casso Holding: An Average Brick Warehouse.

boardgame.name: Goons: 5 Player Expansion
boardgame.description: A 5 Player Expansion for GOONS that includes everything you need to get cracking, including a new goon, extra goon board and 20 orange deluxe mini poker chips!

boardgame.name: Goons: The Sergey Brothers Solo Expansion
boardgame.description: Take on the merciless Sergey Brothers in this solo experience of Goons that also can be used to create more dynamics in 2 player games!

boardgame.name: Goons: The Reinforcement Pack
boardgame.description: Twelve new exciting Schemes to add to the game! A new Scheme for every Villain ever released!

boardgame.name: Goons: Les Promo Card
boardgame.description: A promo Goon Card from the original Kickstarter campaign. He has a unique ability of moving cubes around making it easier to take the action you want.

boardgame.name: Battlecrest: Map Playmat
boardgame.description:
24" x 24" map playmat for Battlecrest.


There are a few things to note. The first is that this is setup for the Fellwoods base set. It uses the art and shape of the Fellwoods map, so when we release the second map set (currently planned for this time next year), we'd release a playmat themed to it as well. There is some utility built into this - the starting player spaces are coded and the map locations are shaded appropriately.

We also started mocking up a generic map playmat - one that could be used for any Battlecrest map we release, but it's not as pretty as it's a different color palette. Due to the possible size of future maps, it loses the art and logo.

boardgame.name: Battlecrest: Player Playmat
boardgame.description:
24" x 24" player playmat for Battlecrest.


We were able to get everything into one head to head playmat that can be used for both 2 player and solo.

You'll see zones for everything. There's your health row, the action card row, and room for an item. You'll also see room for solo cards in the middle. Ignore those if you are playing 2 player, but if you are playing solo...

boardgame.name: Goons: Deluxe Mini Poker Chips
boardgame.description: Upgrade Goons with 80 x Deluxe Mini Poker Chips to replace the Energy Markers in the game!

boardgame.name: Swarms of the Multiverse
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This one-of-a-kind bestiary brings you never-before-seen creatures as well as their swarm equivalents. But these aren't just run-of-the-mill swarms! Each creature has been given a minimum of two pages to help you understand their lore, their habits, their tactics, and why they swarm. Many of the swarms feature differences from their base creatures to keep your party guessing. Plus, we've got tons of bonus material and instructions on how to make swarms that are balanced for fifth edition.

This book includes:

Over 70 brand new creatures and their associated swarms!
All the creatures swarm, have swarm-like abilities, or summon and command swarms
Creatures and swarms of all sizes, including gargantuan!
Creatures and swarms for all environments!
Over 140 stat blocks ranging from CR 0 to 30, including new mechanics, traits, and actions!
Over 150 adventure hooks to help you integrate the creatures into your campaign!
4 new demiplanes to explore, including a demiplane made from books!
Bonus material including magic items, lairs, variants, templates, diseases, factions, and more!
Instructions on how to create swarms that are balanced for fifth edition!
Tips and tools to enhance the swarms you create, including making symbiotic swarm hosts!
50 wild effects!

boardgame.name: Trials of the Spiritwalker
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Woe befall on those who cage us.
No star will guide you in the darkness.
You will cry your own life’s blood.
All that is left - the storm will claim. Free us or despair.

These words appeared in the sky above Bezerov, and it didn't take long for the spirits to follow on their promise. The nights became darker. Then the attacks began.

Trials of the Spiritwalker is a 5th edition adventure that’s focused on exploration, mystery, and meaningful moral choices. The characters’ journey will take them into the Ethereal Plane, a realm of spirits and danger. There, they will uncover a villainous scheme, choose sides in a spiritual dilemma, and reach the heart of an ethereal storm where the final battle takes place.

This adventure is designed for a party of 4-5 characters of 7th level and should provide enough content for two game sessions.

In the appendix, you will find all the spells, magic items and creature stat blocks that were made for this adventure. The appendix also contains an NPC cheat sheet that will help you get into the mindset of each character and several maps that can be used for the combat encounters of the adventure.

boardgame.name: Sepulchre of the Wolf King (5E)
boardgame.description: From publisher blurb:

boardgame.name: Sugar Heist: Crib of Thieves
boardgame.description:
Sugar Heist: Crib of Thieves, a stand-alone and combinable expansion of Sugar Heist, is an action-packed heist game where players collect, trade, and steal candy cards. Quick-to-learn and strategic, Sugar Heist: Crib of Thieves can be played on its own or mixed in with Sugar Heist to create even more great gameplay opportunities!

On your turn, lay down matching sets of candies from your hand and try to draw, steal, and barter for more! The more candy you collect, the closer you are to locking it safely into your Vault. Sometimes though, other players may not want to give you their confectionary treasures and you might have to play a Battle Card. The all new Accessory Cards and Vault scoring add even more variable powers to your game. Execute your strategies and plan your next move to score the most points and win the game! Beg, barter, steal, and battle your way to supremacy in this wacky set collecting game.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: The Lost Saga of Fenrir
boardgame.description:
The Aesir sleeps peacefully, knowing that Fenrir is bound until Ragnarök. But is he? You play as the spirit of Fenrir, reborn as a pup. Travel the realms by hunting, scouting and exploring different sites. Your actions will influence how you get stronger. By enlisting the help of Gods and creatures alike, your goal is to free yourself from the torturing reigns of Gleipnir.

In this "choose your own adventure"-campaign, the choices you make will impact what happens next. Will you be able to free yourself? Will the Aesir discover that your spirit has broken free and hunt you down? Will you discover and aid the Vanir's plot against the Aesir? You decide! With the use of modular hexagonal tiles, action-based strength increases and multiple story arcs, each playthrough will feel unique.

A true solo board game, where you play as a wolf. "Choose your own"-adventure campaigns set in Norse mythology. Focused on narrative, exploration, battle, and character building.

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Mega Mini Space Cowboys
boardgame.description:
Across the Great Void, mankind has colonized planets like islands dotting a vast jet-black ocean. Vital to the Solarline Syndicate are the spacefaring ships that transport passengers, cargo and cattle. But as everyone knows - any ship is only as good as it's crew!

In Mega Mini Space Cowboys, players assemble a motley crew of misfits that find a new family in each other. Shipmates come in all shapes and sizes. Some are skilled pilots, while others specialize in hand-to-hand combat or ship repair. Some are even bounty hunters. But life is not always so black and white. Sometimes under the right circumstances, the criminal can join the crew, bringing their own set of unique skills to a peculiar, yet accepting, new family.

Mega Mini Space Cowboys is a fast-playing 1-4 player strategy game of set collection with exclusive dice and modular mapping. Each turn, roll six dice, each engraved with six symbols: Move, Nano Med Kit, Bounty, Passenger, Crates, or Cattle. Over three consecutive throws, choose what to keep or discard. You can also recruit crewmates from the passengers you meet, or occasionally even the criminals that you track for bounties.

Hey spacer - do you have the moxie to make big Moolings? (in-game money) Can your family of misfits survive distant planet-hopping and navigating the Void? Stay tuned for the next game session of Mega Mini Space Cowboys to find out!

Later, Space Cowboy…

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Rivenstone
boardgame.description:
The Broken Anvil Miniatures Team is proud to present Rivenstone, a brand new tabletop miniature skirmish wargame featuring highly detailed miniatures and thrilling tempo-based gameplay! Rivenstone is an alternating activation, skirmish-style tabletop wargame designed to appeal to players of all experience levels. The rules are easy to understand and play, with loads of strategic depth to explore and experience on the tabletop. Reinforcement mechanics prevent a player from losing to attrition, creating a game focused on tempo based decisions and tactical planning instead.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: El Rif: Una Guerra Olvidada
boardgame.description:
The Rif War, also called the Second Moroccan War, was an armed conflict fought from 1911 to 1927 between the Spanish colonial authorities and the French colonial Empire and the Berber tribes of the mountainous Rif region of Northern Morocco.

El Rif: Una Guerra Olvidada ("The Rif, a forgotten war"), is a 2 player card driven wargame which depicts the war in the Rif region of Northern Morocco from 1911-1927.

The Rif includes a deck of strategy cards for conducting campaigns and incorporating the many events and personalities of the war. The Spanish player can build special units 5Legion, regulares, tanks), naval and air units, pacifiy the rebel kabyles, and work towards French intervention. The Rifian player can build up his kabyles, revolt enemy units of the indigenous police and proclame the the Republic of the Rif.

MAP SCALE: Point-to-point system
UNIT SCALE: regiment per counter

Components:
140 1/2” die cut counters
One 22x34" full-color mapsheet showing most of Northern Morocco
54 Strategy Cards
32-page Rule Book including historial background (21 pages of actual rules)

DESIGNER: Ivan Notario
DEVELOPER: Carlos Martin
ART DIRECTOR: Ignacio Notario
MAP ART: Pascal Lapouyade
CARDS & COUNTER ART: Ivan Notario

boardgame.name: Magic: The Gathering – Challenger Deck: Allied Fires
boardgame.description: Allied Fires is a planeswalker control deck. Keep the board clear with cards like Deafening Clarion and Time Wipe, play a bunch of planeswalkers that generate card advantage, and overwhelm the opponent with planeswalker value and even planeswalker attacks with the help of Sarkhan the Masterless.

boardgame.name: Cheese & Crackers
boardgame.description:
The Queen is planning to host a fancy afternoon tea...and only the freshest cheese and crackers will do. Perfect! You think, cheese and crackers are your specialty! Unfortunately you're not the only one...

Outmanoeuvre the competition in this delightful 18-card worker placement game, to prepare your ingredients and finish making your cheese and crackers before the competition does. Lovely!

The game is played in a series of rounds, each consisting of three phases. Players place workers (phase one), take a total of two actions each (phase two), then workers return to players and action cards are reshuffled and laid out to start a new round (phase three).

Players are racing to be the first to complete making both cheese and crackers, by rotating and flipping their cheese and crackers cards until their cheese card has "8. Cheese!" at the top and their crackers card has "8. Crackers!" at the top, at which point the player yells "Lovely!" to win the game.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Lumineth Realm-Lords
boardgame.description:
The Lumineth Realm-lords seek to purify the Mortal Realms, scouring the taint of Chaos wherever it’s found. Some brave warbands take the battle to the enemy, striking deep into the Eightpoints itself to hunt the vile servants of the Dark Gods at their source.

With elements of three kits to choose from, this box allows you to tailor your warband to be highly aggressive, defensive, or a balance of the two. They fight like nothing else in the game with ranged weapons, plus heavy armour and loads of unique abilities. Beyond the Vanari Auralan Sentinels, Vanari Auralan Wardens, and the Alarith Stoneguard, you’ll also find fighter cards for a variety of other models from the Lumineth Realm-lords range. Add some cavalry, superbly skilled warriors, and wielders of elemental magic to your warband, and there's nothing that you can't take on.

Contents:
15 Miniatures
‣ 5 Alarith Stoneguard
‣ 5 Vanari Auralan Wardens
‣ 5 Vanari Auralan Sentinels
15 Round Bases (32mm)
Lumineth Realm-lords Wound Divider & Abilities Cards
19 Fighter Cards
84 Tokens

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: Love Battleship
boardgame.description:
Love Battleship is a sex board game for couples. It builds anticipation with every sinking ship as the losing player performs steamy foreplay activities.
The winner is whoever sinks all of their opponent’s ships first. Love Battleship includes game grids for each player. On one grid, each player draws their ships, while on the other you each mark your guesses for where your opponent’s ships are placed. When you successfully sink your partner’s ship, you pick a foreplay or activity card to perform.
Nevertheless, this game is designed for both players to enjoy it whether they win or lose. Love Battleship game is meant to keep the passion alive while having a hot and steamy night in a fun and playful way.
There are 25 intimate activities and 25 foreplay activities included, so you can play this game several times, and each time will be just as exciting as the first. Love Battleship comes with enough game grids to play eight times, but if you wish to play more, you can download or draw additional grids as well.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Biz
boardgame.description:
In Biz, you take over a building and play as the owner of an organization. By identifying the market and the available opportunities, you hire people for your organization. These Human Resources make money for the organization in every fiscal year. There are also competitors who are trying to gain a bigger share of the market.
Biz board game is categorized in Reality games. This simulation game is part of the structure and performance of real organizations. The simulated experience of this board game is a fascinating experience that anyone can have fun with. Factors that affect the development process of an organization in the real world, may not be possible to be identified or experienced in the real world. But in this board game, all the exposed factors can be identified and examined, and with each re-play, a new experience and transition can be discovered. There are a variety of situations in the game, opportunities and human resources may change your predetermined goal. The number of players in this game is from one to four people, and you get a different experience of the game with any number of players and even single player.

Game Goal
The goal of the game is for organizations to achieve the popularity of the top brand in the eyes of the audience. This popularity can be achieved in three ways:

Popularity gained through the effects of Activity cards.
The popularity that is formed through Human Resources (Employees) within the organization.
The popularity that is created for players by earning over 40 points Revenue.


Finally, the sum of the popularity point obtained from these three methods determines the brand popularity of an entire organization.

Game End
The game ends when Time marker cube reach number 8 on Organizational Life Cycle Board (i.e. The 8th round of the game that every player completed their turns).
Organizational Life Cycle Board
.Revenue on 5
Salary on 0 Profit on 5
This Board is consisting of 8 fiscal years, meaning there are 8 rounds in the game. After placing the Time Marker on fiscal year 8, the game ends. Each player has to take steps, after all the players have taken their turn, that round ends. At the beginning of the next round, you have to repeat those steps again, then to go to the next round.

Employee Cards
There are 66 Employee cards in the game, each employee has two abilities. By hiring that employee with the ability you choose, you bring him/her into your organization.
At the beginning of the game, Shuffle the 66 cards well and place them face down in the middle of the game area. Then place 6 cards from the employee deck face up next to the deck. When any player picks one employee, a card must be replaced. So until the end of the game, there are always 6 employee cards face up in the game area.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Ukrainian Nightmare: Objective Kharkiv 2021
boardgame.description:
After years of quasi-peace since 2016, the Donetsk and Luhansk separatist armies that Russia supported and built-up launched another attack with the aim of seizing more territory. It was hoped to occupy the city of Kharkov and Dnipro but even more modest gains would have political and military value, in addi-tion, further destabilize the Ukrainian government.
Both sides had similar military strength with 35,000 front line troops manning the fortified front lines. The DPA and LNR, 914 AFVs, 720 artillery guns, 202 rocket artillery between the two pro-Russian forces. Each had around 200 tanks. Among these were at least 2100 Russian forces to assist. However, Putin also had placed elements from the 3rd Motorized Division along the northern border from its 20th Army and the 150th Division not far near the Crimea. The 150th was quite strong with two tank regiments and two mechanized infantry regiments. Either or both, if used, would be a decisive in seizing more Ukrainian territory.
The Ukrainian forces were capable and equal in most aspects, especially their elite units that proved their worth in 2014 and 2015. The front lines were vintage WW1 with trench lines and fortified areas along the main avenues of approach. Many of the Ukrainian units were mainly reinforced battalion strength de-spite their regimental or brigade designation. In fact, many "bri-gades" only had one or two battalions.
While they had many more AFVs, many needed refitting or repaired as with much of their equipment. The one new weapon was the American Javelin AT. Ukraine had 47 launchers and 360 missiles which could be used against armor and structures. They also had 12 Turkish Bayraktar UAV for reconnaissance.
As in previous battles, both fought with tenacity and the tipping point was always whether the Russians would send in their units, which they did in 2014, 2015. The other potential was whether the Americans also send in help from Poland.
With both sides facing each other since 2016 in a quasi-peace, both the DPA and LNR forces had built up and trained their forces with Russian aid. The Ukrainians also built up forces and created a fortified line along main avenues of advance. Finally, sometime in 2020, Putin decided to try to get a larger section of the Ukraine in 2021. The offensive would be limited.

Designed by Perry Moore in 2020, this game seems prophetic on the battle of Kharkiv in Feb to May 2022. along with the use of Javelins and supply issues for the Russian army.

boardgame.name: Eastern District Detective
boardgame.description:
Solo time musical game which is designed based on AGF initiatively to instill a life long passion and understanding of music and its concepts through a fun hands on experience.
Game story
The territory of Parug expanded with technology and high-rise buildings. Next to the territory of Parug, there was the land of Mintras, which, unlike Parug, was far from technology.
The people of Mintras were creatures and human beings who worked in every field of thought. The mayor of Parug built strong gates throughout the territory to keep the distance between the people of Parug and the creatures and humans of Mintras.

Sequential Action method:
A game round consists of a Repeating Action and a Sequential Action. This means that at the beginning of each round you have to select a Repeating Action and after performing it, select a Sequential Action and do it so the round ends.
After you have selected a Sequential Action from a set in the first round of the game, you must use the following sets in the next round, you are not allowed to return to the previous sets. When you reach set 5, you must return to set 1. This process is repeated until the end of the 24 minute soundtrack.
So in each round, you have a Repeating Action that is constant and you can use one of them in each round. After using duplicate operations, select one at the beginning of the game from set 1 of sequential operations. In the next round, when it comes to selecting Sequential Action, you have to choose from set 2 and so on.
End of the Game
There are 3 Endings in the game:

IF the 24 minute soundtrack is finished.
If you cannot detain a creature in 4 rounds.
If Villains or creatures decks runs out.


Scoring
After the 24 minute and the end of the game, you count your points. Every resolved case worth 1 point and every detained creature are 5 points. Count your whole points and record it on the Detective Sheet every time you play the game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Putin's Pocket: Ukrainian Cauldron at Debaltseve – Feb 2015
boardgame.description:
Putin's Pocket is a game on the face-off between Ukrainian and Russian forces at the Debaltseve pocket, which protruded like a finger into the Russian\DPR front lines in January, 2015.

The pro-Russian forces were unable to collapse the Ukrainian pocket or cut it off in January even as Putin allowed Russian battalion tactical groups to gradually take over. The whole area became a target for the many Russian artillery within range and was heavily bombarded.

boardgame.name: Donetsk!: Ukrainian Inferno at Ilovaisk – August 2014
boardgame.description: Ukrainian Inferno is a game on the near success of the Ukrainian forces during August, 2014. In July, these forces had cut up and isolated many of the pro-Russian forces called the DPA who were fully supported by Russia. The Ukrainian forces were in a near win position after months of fighting, having cut the main arteries for supply used by the DPA. While it looked promising, there remained one main highway used by the DPA that supplied those forces in and around Donetsk, a large urban-like area they controlled.

boardgame.name: Disputed Land: War in Azerbaijan – 2020
boardgame.description:
Disputed Land covers the flashpoint war between Armenia and Azerbaijan over the Armenian controlled territory of Nagorno-Karabakh, which was won in 1994.

This territory was Azerbaijan's prior to 1994. The loss was never agreed to and remained a bone of contention between the two countries. As time went on, Azerbaijan became sovereign country and quickly built up its former Soviet army. Russia remains allied to both countries now but has a defense pact with Armenia. It also sells both countries its military weapons.

While Azerbaijan built up its military forces that are superior to Arme-nia, Armenia did could not match them due to the fact Azerbaijan used revenue from oil. By 2020, it was time for Azerbaijan to reclaim the disputed loss area.

In late September of 2020, Azer forces made a surprise attack across the Nagorno front positions and slowly made in roads. The opposing forces were fewer but it was the terrain that would determine success. But the war did bring into view future warfare using deadly armed drones that Azer forces bought from Turkey and Israel. Unable to shoot them down, Armenian tanks and radar were decimated within a week losing 173 T-72 tanks, 257 APC, 67 rocket launched artillery, 23 SAM, and 14 radar. It was a staggering blow and great military feat of future warfare tactics.

Eventually, Armenia agreed to a ceasefire in mid-October. Azer forces took the time to redirect their offensive and unleash its 1st Corps along the Iranian border on the 18th. This was a brilliant move catching the Armenian forces off guard in the Fuzuli\Fizuli area. the Azer armor and mechanized formations raced deep into Nagorno territory coming with-in 20 km of the key town of Lachin in the mountains. If taken, Azer would cutoff the only supply road into Nagorno. As Azer forces cau-tiously approached, Armenian military units in Goris began to counter-attack halting further advance. Being that the two lane road was sur-rounded my 4000 ft. mountains, Azer forces pulled back on Oct. 24.

Now, Azer forces switched to another attack from Fizuli towards Shusha and the Nagorno capital. This main attack was a slugfest due to the mountainous terrain. Armenian troops fought tooth and nail but by Nov.4, Azer forces were within 10 km of Stepanakert and nearly sur-rounded Shusha. If either fell, again, the main supply road would be cut. Bitter fighting and artillery fire continued until Nov. 9, when Shusha fell to Azer.

It was now Armenia agreed to Russia's peace plan. Estimated losses were up to 8000 men, well over 300 tanks lost total and hundreds of artillery guns or rocket launchers.
LESS

DETOX a drinking card game.

The essence of the game: Each card has a task to complete. If you don't comply, you must drink. There are many, many exciting tasks ahead of you. You might even grow a mustache during the game, or you might lose a cold shower, but you might even finally be able to lick your elbows. Why choose the DETOX drinking game:

It is 2x the size of a French card, so you will see it perfectly even when drunk.

Made of the highest quality material.

boardgame.description: This item combines two previously separate expansions to Hostage Negotiator (Abductor Pack 9 and Abductor Pack 10).

boardgame.name: Hostage Negotiator: Pack Peticiones #1 y #2

Demand Pack #1 is an expansion pack that comes with 16 new cards that will add new major demands for the original abductors (Arkayne, Donna, and Edward) as well as the abductors from Abductor Packs 1-2 and 3-4. These cards will breathe new life into abductors you've faced off against before.

Exposed is a party game where you can find out what your friends think about you and who they think is most likely to do absurd things.

boardgame.name: USC Reach
boardgame.description:
USC Reach is a competitive turn-based space journey game for 2 to 4 players, where you discover the marvels of the universe, rescue rookie space travelers, scavenge resources, and improve your Crew and ship, by using deck building, hand management, and variable phase order mechanics.

Your goal is to secure a safe landing on the new planet and collect the most points to win the game. To do that, gather your crew and allocate them strategically to your ship departments to overcome the challenges of space before others while keeping an eye on your landing requirements.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Shattered Dungeon
boardgame.description:
Double-sided 24" x 30" unfolded maps of an ancient, partially-collapsed dungeon, with lava fissures on one side.

Wet, dry, and permanent marker erasable.

boardgame.name: Christmas Scavenger Hunt
boardgame.description: Christmas Scavenger Hunt features hundreds of cards with typical objects that can be found around the house at Christmas. Deal out some cards to each team and get hunting. It's that simple!

boardgame.name: The House of Straw
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The House of Straw is a Fifth Edition adventure designed and optimized for four players of 1st level. This adventure works well in a creepy forest or remote wilderness.

Background
Several years ago an elderly human warlock engaged in dark rituals to gain power and demonic servants. With the powers she gained, the witch would offer magic wards and favors to those who desperately sought her aid. While the woman was vile and sadistic in life her evil influence was shallow and she left not much of a trace of her dark works after she died. The most curious thing she left behind was her scarecrow servants that tend to her remains and property. While not outwardly violent, these constructs have created an eerie aura in the vicinity they inhabit. These scarecrows are protective of the witch's home. Perhaps a secret treasure lies somewhere within it?

Features
• Full monster illustrations to show players
• 2 original battlemaps
• A new boss monster to fight
• A new magic item to find

boardgame.name: The Mask of Dour
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Mask of Dour is a Fifth Edition adventure designed and optimized for four players of 1st level. This adventure works well as an epic starting quest to hook players into a campaign. It works well set in a secluded wilderness or a site of ancient ruins close to a village or city.

Background
Many centuries ago the kingdom of Dour existed under the rule of the Dour monarchy. The kingdom was once a barony that steadily grew from a keep and homestead to a sizeable city-state. Some years into the kingdom's growth the elven kingdom of Liadon wished to make an ally of Dour and presented the royal family with a fine mask carved of ivory that was to be a token of goodness and prosperity for the kingdom. Generations passed and the kingdom of Dour continued to prosper and a new king was crowned: King Julian Dour. Julian led the kingdom justly: he defended its borders, made allies for its neighbors, and cared for its people. One day Julian was visited by a raven who told him he was a patron from the god of justice sent to lead Julian to greatness, a greatness that no other king had risen to before. The raven said his name was Balteau and Julian proudly accepted his council. Over the years Balteau's wisdom proved valuable and the kingdom of Dour became strong. Despite his success by the words of his patron, Julian kept his bird companion a secret from everyone, even his wife Queen Amelia. Little did Julian know, Balteau was literally a devil in disguise or rather a demon in disguise. Balteau was a quasit bent on twisting Julian's heart to darkness. A decade after their meeting, Balteau had Julian's complete and total trust, his soft and comforting voice merged with Julian’s own will and desires. Eventually, Julian's deeds as king began to darken: executions for minor infractions, invasions to secure new wealth, and no help for the kingdom's sick and poor. It wasn’t long before a coup was plotted against King Julian and his cruelty. But Balteau warned the king of this plot and so Julian delivered swift and merciless retribution to the usurpers. He commanded his most loyal men to slaughter the soldiers who were trying to overthrow his kingdom. Fully in the grasp of the quasit, Julian began to roil in paranoia causing him to hastily strike down the rest of his guards and staff in an attempt to halt any more plots against him. The morning after this dark and bloody day began with a mighty quake that split the earth, swallowing up the king's castle. This quake was divine judgment enacted by the god of justice, in retribution against King Dour smearing his divine name. Thus sealing the fate of the wicked king and putting an end to the kingdom of Dour.

Features
• Full monster and NPC illustrations to show players
• Two new 5e monsters and a boss NPC
• Two new large, full color battlemaps
• Illustrated magic items

boardgame.name: Wollo's Warren
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wollo’s Warren is a Fifth Edition adventure designed and optimized for four players of 3rd level. This adventure works set in a small village, a remote keep or dungeon or in a large city.

Background
Wollo was always a curious Kobold, ever since the day she was hatched. She wasn't remarkable to say the least, simply another in her horde. This horde did as most kobold hordes do: hunt, scavenge and become subservient to a larger master. In Wollo’s case this master was a young red dragon. Wollo hated the years that followed. The dragon was cruel and had no value for its hundreds of kobold underlings. Although her horde was better fed and had more shiny trinkets, Wollo knew life was better before the dragon. This continued until one day a group of adventurers came into the red dragon's lair. Many kobolds were slain on this day but ultimately the red dragon herself fell to the heroes. Wollo couldn't believe it! She was free! Wollo fled that lair and decided from then on only Wollo would be in charge of Wollo. Wollo traveled far away from her former home. She scavenged and hid, fled and stole, until one day she found the entrance to a large and forgotten dungeon: the lair of a long-passed wizard! Wollo began to pour through his belongings and over time taught herself rudimentary arcane magic. She played with the arcane and began crafting minions made of ooze to keep herself company. Now content with her life, Wollo is blissfully unaware of the danger and havoc her new "hobby" is creating.

boardgame.name: Den of the Werespiders
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Den of the Werespiders is a Fifth Edition adventure designed and optimized for four players of 7th level. This adventure works well set in a secluded forest that people usually avoid. It also works well to introduce a new PC or if a few players are absent for a session.

Background
No one ventures into the Lost Wood. As its name suggests, those who do venture into this cursed forest are rarely seen again. Many dark and twisted creatures dwell here. So do beings who wish to live outside the gaze of greater society. Nadeen and Qwendynn Chiss are two such souls. Drow partners and outcasts from their city, Nadeen and Qwendynn were both revered members of their society. Nadeen was once an ascending acolyte to the high priestess of the Queen of Spiders until a potent strain of lycanthropy infected her. This curse changed her into a dreaded werespider. Once word got out of her condition she was forced out by her kin, the curse believed to be a divine judgment from their demonic goddess. Qwendynn, who had only known the scorn and scrutiny of his society, was more than willing to join his wife in her exile. Others like Nadeen, cursed with new terrifying forms, were found lingering in the Lost Wood. As years marched on, other wretches and vile beings slowly joined this growing band. A cult began amassing and soon started capturing lonely travelers to be devoured by their members...

Features
• Full monster illustrations to show players
• Two new 5e monsters and two boss NPCs
• A new large, full color battlemap
• A two new magics item to find

boardgame.name: Scrapper's Hive
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Scrapper’s Hive is a Fifth Edition adventure designed and optimized for four players of 1st level. This adventure works well placed in a remote wilderness location or near a rural town or village.

Background
Scrapper the ankheg was a simple, solitary creature. She normally hunted and ate moles, badgers, and other rodents that burrowed into her small cave. About a month ago a colony of pincers, small bipedal burrowing creatures, invaded her cave and began to attack. While Scrapper defeated some, the pincers' numbers prove too much for her and she has started leaving her comfy cave to hunt for food. These hunts have been leading her closer and closer to nearby towns, she has begun to set her sight son larger prey, like horses and livestock.

Features
• Full monster illustrations to show players
• Full color battlemap
• New 5e monster

boardgame.name: A Wyrm in Somberwold
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Wyrm in Somberwold is a Fifth Edition adventure designed and optimized for four players of 2nd level. This adventure works well in small town settling, but can work in a urban suburb.

Background
The town of Somberwold is a quiet, humble, country town. Many goods move in and out of its walls including grain, beef, pork, poultry and produce. Valor Hall is a former military keep that stands as a testament to a trying time. There was an age in which Somberwold had to defend itself against endless streams of marauders and orcs. Today the single-story structure stands as a ruined memory of a battle almost lost. Since the new military outpost, Somberwold Hall was built Valor Hall has sat empty and is avoided by most in town. Many residents believe the spirits of fallen soldiers who fought to protect the town still linger within.
The truth is a black dragon wyrmling moved into the hall some time ago and made herself at home. Fennryth, is her name, and she has plans to keep herself in hiding until the time comes to rise up and overthrow the township. Somberwold will be the first settlement of her future empire. She has done her best to conceal her presence but some have noticed the small dragon hunting for food throughout the day. To avoid confrontations Fennryth started a ruse by unleashing terrible moaning and disembodied voices of torment in the night. These sounds sold the myth that the hall is haunted and to be avoided. Will this beast continue to avoid suspicion or will the adventurers have something to say about it?

Features
• Full monster illustrations to show players
• An original battlemap
• A new magic item to find

boardgame.name: The Lair of Kessig
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Lair of Kessig is a Fifth Edition adventure designed and optimized for four players of 2nd level. This adventure works well as an epic adventure for new players, with the dragon is small the pay-off can be big!

Background
Kessig, the green dragon wyrmling, is the spawn of an ancient green dragon who dwells in a far-off land. Kessig was treated with scorn and hatred by his siblings and parents which he viciously fought off to survive in his brood. Not long after his hatching Kessig left the lair of his parents, searching for a place to begin his future treasure horde and domain. Kessig soon found such a place in a forgotten complex built into the rock of a tall crag. In the surrounding lands, quiet whispers and vivid dreams began to call those with foul hearts and a lust for blood. These whispers came from the Queen of Evil Dragons herself, her words beckoning lost souls to follow the young wyrmling. Soon after a cult was born and now the queen waits for Kessig to prove himself worthy.

Features
• Full monster illustrations to show players
• A new large battlemap
• A new magic item to find

boardgame.name: Village of Hommlet
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Want to run the classic module but no time to whip up the maps?
No problem! Here's your solution!

This is a homage to the classic module! Includes fully detailed areas, based on the descriptions but given the Instant Dungeon Crawl interpretation! Includes the famous inn; the guard tower; the ruins of the moat house; and the moat house dungeon.

Empty room map versions are also included so you can re-use the maps or if you want to stock them yourself!
For less than a dollar a map! What a deal!

boardgame.name: Slave Pits of the Undercity
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Want to run the classic module but no time to whip up the maps?
No problem! Here's your solution!

This is a homage to the classic adventure module! Includes fully detailed areas, based on the descriptions but given the Instant Dungeon Crawl interpretation! Includes the infamous ruined temple and the sewer dungeon crawl beneath it and a numbered guide for each map to help make running the adventure easier.

But that's not all! Empty room map versions are also included so you can re-use the maps or if you want to stock them yourself!

boardgame.name: Castle Amber
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Want to run the classic module but no time to whip up the maps?
No problem! Here's your solution!

This is a homage to the classic module! Includes fully detailed areas, based on the descriptions but given the Instant Dungeon Crawl interpretation! Check out the indoor forest maps!!

Empty room map versions are also included so you can re-use the maps or if you want to stock them yourself!

boardgame.name: Malkadunia
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The inhabitants of Malkadunia are descendants of a matriarchy in one of ancient Earth’s African countries. The harsh environment — high gravity combined with a hot climate — tempered the people into muscular and stoic figures able to conquer anything the planet threw at them. But their sense of traditionalism is in conflict with the interstellar government’s progressiveness. Meanwhile, the planet’s embattled queen finds herself embroiled in one intrigue after another, as ambitious nobles line up to try their hand at taking her down.

Port of Call: Malkadunia introduces Cepheus Engine, Cepheus Deluxe, and Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game players to this hard world that has hardened its inhabitants in turn. Inside, Referees and Players will find an overview of how the information would appear in the PCs’ library database; physical planetary and system information; a brief history; a look at the Malkadunian governmental structure, tech level and society; a quick guide to crafting characters that come from the planet; and a detailed map of the planet

Port of Call: Malkadunia. All hail the Queen!

boardgame.name: Sepulchre of the Wolf King (OSR)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A pair of exceedingly large, powerful and ferocious ogres prey on travellers and merchants alike from their crumbling, subterranean home, but have no idea what deathless horrors lurk in the deeper dark below their noisome lair.

Sepulchre of the Wolf King is a short dungeon adventure designed for four to five 5th-level characters. Nominally set in the Duchy of Ashlar to the north of the town of Dunstone, the adventure can be placed in any hilly, wooded area beset by lawlessness and banditry.

boardgame.name: ¿Qué Hace un Hombre con una Sardina en la Cabeza?
boardgame.description:
It all started in a chance encounter with old Captain Sargasso. He was going down the street alone, lurching to port and starboard and bumping into everything that got in his way. When he crossed paths with me, he took my arm tightly and showed me a worn and half-torn map, with drawings and nonsensical phrases that filled each sheet.

Then, out of the blue, he burst out laughing, left me the map and said goodbye shouting into the wind: "And that's how I ended up with a sardine on my head!" Since then I have had time to look at that old nautical chart many times, and I have always been curious to know what they meant, and what meaning those phrases and drawings had and, of course, what relationship they had with a sardine on the head of a man.

Maybe you are able to make sense of this story... Or not.

In addition to this witty story, the game brings a series of images and texts that will make sense when you put your imagination to work. There is only one question: What is a man doing with a sardine on his head? but countless possible answers. From the cards and their combination, you will be able to create a new story every time. Perhaps it will be a long story; maybe small or even a single scene. But you will take the helm, in the way you want on each occasion.

The proposal of this game arose as a search. The original idea was to make a book album as open as possible: that each person, when reading it, would create their own meanings, make their own plot. This is how this book-game was born that proposes you to establish the reading rules, play with visual and written language to shape the narrative, create connections that only you will know and enjoy a different way of reading.

boardgame.name: Tokaido Duo
boardgame.description: In Tokaido Duo, you move on an island, seeing stuff and making memories.

boardgame.name: Legendary Mediums: Second Edition
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bind the Powers of the Beyond!

Legendary Mediums is the latest in the player-focused line of supplements for Pathfinder Second Edition, centering on the skillful and adaptable medium class. Tap into an incredible array of psychospiritual abilities, featuring over 30 class options for binding yourself to spirits like the Adept and the Magician, attuning yourself to the anima, kami, servitor, or the mysterious void. That's just the beginning, as you'll also find over 100 class feats, focus spells, magic items, skill unlocks, and more! Unlock your powers with Necromantic Conduit and Unsettling Presence, foresee the future with Unfinished Business and Branching Possibilities, and strike fear into your enemies with Everlasting Terror and We Know. Wield magical tools like the soulseeing mirror and spells like poltergeist outbreak, ethereal mantle, and exile soul. Finally, master expanded skill uses with classic occult talents like Dowsing, Psychometry, Automatic Writing, and Exorcism! If you ever wanted to explore the mysteries of the occult, this versatile class can fill many roles by specializing in martial, magical, or informational talents.

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Alien Worlds – Crystalline Canyon/Badlands Battlemat
boardgame.description: Each map is 34" x 22", the perfect "two-map" size for most games. The maps are high-resolution with great color quality, making them some of the most beautiful and durable BattleTech maps ever produced. The neoprene is also thin for ease of storage, and double-sided for versatility.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Wolves of Odin
boardgame.description:
Wolves of Odin is a strategy card game with deep gameplay and great replay value.

On your turn, you take one of several available actions, for example you can play a Viking card to create or grow your own squad of warriors. Or, you can play a Viking card on an enemy squad to kill enemy warrior (to discard this card). At the end of round, players will summ the strengths of their squads of warriors and player who creates strongest squad will receive victory point(s). The game is played up to 5 victory points.

Instead of play a Viking card you can sacrifice your warriors to summon ancient gods with powerful game-changing abilities.

The game consists of series of rounds, as result of which one of the players scores 5 victory points and ends the game, so it is important to correctly calculate strength of your cards in each round.

Wolves of Odin has simple rules, but serious dilemmas arise every turn. Multiple layers of strategies create a wealth of tactical possibilities. There is also unusual passing system in the game: when a player passes, he draws new 4 cards into his hand from the deck, and every time his turn reaches him, he again draws 1 card into his hand and then discard 1 card from his hand. Thus, while other players are depleting their strength in the current round, passing player is building up power for the next round...

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

The maps are high-resolution with great color quality, making them some of the most beautiful and durable BattleTech maps ever produced. The neoprene is also thin for ease of storage, and double-sided for versatility.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Mystery of the Indus Valley
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Mystery of the Indus Valley is a text adventure with pictures.

boardgame.description: Each map is 34" x 22", the perfect "two-map" size for most games. The neoprene is also thin for ease of storage, and double-sided for versatility.

boardgame.description: Each map is 34" x 22", the perfect "two-map" size for most games. The maps are high-resolution with great color quality, making them some of the most beautiful and durable BattleTech maps ever produced. The neoprene is also thin for ease of storage, and double-sided for versatility.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Psychic Sound Tourists
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

In the remotest part of the desert, there stands an ancient tower. Abandoned long ago by some forgotten civilization, it is nonetheless a place that sees the most remarkable of visitors. Slug people from beyond the stars come here to ride their flying carpets. They are rare, however. Some who have made the forbidding trek out to this remote building say they have waited days or even weeks to see this singular sight. But they also say it was worth it.

This tower once held a magic gateway, used to bring strange beasts to this world, perhaps so they could fight in the arena. Or maybe they were used to guard the riches of the wizards who build this portal, who can say what the ancients did, now that their works are so far in the past? These visitors use the gate because they enjoy the acoustics of this site. The warm sun, the soft sand, and the strange tower — this, apparently, is what makes it a tourist destination.

These intelligent slugs have only recently been introduced to
the human concepts of light and vision. While they are interested in such abilities, too many of their wizards who have come here to experiment with such foreign notions have been driven mad. They used spells to evolve their bodies, but then they did not stop. Their bodies warped beyond recognition and their motivations became as alien as this world is to them (and theirs is to us). Thus it is rare for them to venture further out than this tower, which they enjoy too much to shun completely. The acoustics, you see, are just too good.

boardgame.name: DIE! DIE! DIE! PIG ORC!
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

From there, wandering!

The Middle Lands are full! The Empire to the south has fallen as well! Go west! Nobody wants us here! True grief and sadness!

Rumors of the farthest southwestern settlement.

One can take the trail or the sea!

The High Forest!

HIGHHILL Town!

This place is being flooded by the desperate refugees fleeing from their lands and is quickly becoming crowded. Every day, add 1d100 people.

Now there are rumors that the Pig Orcs have came out of the ground to the Southwest and now are plaguing this land so say the Rangers. Ever growing in numbers! The rangers killed many but there are around 30 or so, getting a base ready!

There is no other place to go!

There is one thing we must do!

Make them DIE!

DIE! DIE! DIE! PIG ORC!

boardgame.name: Sivatagi Bújócska
boardgame.description: The meerkats are cheerfully hiding in their desert homes. Where they hide, where they emerge from their lair. If you manage to get a small animal in all the passages of a nest, you will be rewarded. Who can collect most of the butterfly disks? Try to hide the meerkats from the outpost in the nest! If they run back, find them another flight!

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Édition Côte d'Azur
boardgame.description:
Monopoly at the French Côte d'Azur - edited for the International Game Festival in Cannes 2000.

Limitied edition with number on the board
- wooden houses und hotels
- playing pieces in gold-colored metal.

Tirage original édité à l'occasion du Festival International des Jeux de Cannes. Édition numerotée à tirage limité.
Maisons et hôtels en bois. Pions de jeu en métal doré.

boardgame.name: Push Into Darkness
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Take your adventures further with Push Into Darkness!...Push Into Darkness is a standalone expansion focused on exploration, discovery, and achievement. It's designed for solo or group play, and you can switch seamlessly between the two modes if you want.

All you need to play is a pair of six-sided dice, a pencil, and some paper to record your characters and their adventures. Push Into Darkness takes care of the rest. Featuring prompts for story inspiration and character creation, it actively engages your imagination and creativity. A series of intuitive gameplay loops facilitate storytelling in a way that's natural and organic.

The rules allow you to succeed at almost any task, at least partially, but the push-your-luck mechanic gives you the option to increase your rewards. Is the risk worth it? Push your dice to find out!

Push Into Darkness is suitable for playing games in any setting. Use the book on its own, or combine it effortlessly with the RPG rules of your choice to make storytelling and gameplay progression fast and simple. The inclusion of safety tools make it more inclusive for everyone at the table.

This book is for everyone. Experienced roleplaying enthusiasts? Yes! Entire families? Sure! Anyone who wants to unwind alone with a good story? Absolutely!

Crack open Push Into Darkness and start playing right away. The rules only take a moment to learn!

boardgame.name: Stuart Little 3: Big Photo Adventure
boardgame.description:
Following the destruction of George's photography project in a freak flying accident, Stuart Little must save the day by scampering around New York City snapping everything in sight! Donning an exciting wardrobe, including golfing attire, a Native American costume, and a fireman's uniform, Stuart will gain extra abilities required to complete his daring challenges. Along the way, players can explore the Big Apple in a range of miniature vehicles including a stunt bike, a helicopter, a speedboat, and a military tank.

http://ps2.gamespy.com/playstation-2/stuart-little-3/

boardgame.name: Founders of Teotihuacan: Extra Bonus Disks
boardgame.description:
4 bonus tokens you can mix with the bonus tokens of the base game. Each of them gives you more rewards (a combination of the usual rewards as a built action, an influence action, extra resources,...) compared to the ones from the base game, but at the cost of one action.

These tokens were free if you pre-ordered Founders of Teotihuacan from the Board & Dice webshop during a certain period and they can now be bought from their webshop.
